verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वम॑ग्ने॒ द्युभि॒स्त्वमा॑शुशु॒क्षणि॒स्त्वम॒द्भ्यस्त्वमश्म॑न॒स्परि॑ त्वं वने॑भ्य॒स्त्वमोष॑धीभ्य॒स्त्वं नृ॒णां नृ॑पते जायसे॒ शुचिः॑
verses.transliteration: tvám agne dyúbhis tvám āśuśukṣáṇis  tvám adbhyás tvám áśmanas pári  tváṃ vánebhyas tvám óṣadhībhyas  tváṃ nr̥ṇā́ṃ nr̥pate jāyase śúciḥ

translation.text: THOU, Agni, shining in thy glory through the days, art brought to life from out the waters, from the stone: From out the forest trees and herbs that grow on ground, thou, Sovran Lord of men art generatad (sic) pure.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तवा॑ग्ने हो॒त्रं तव॑ पो॒त्रमृ॒त्वियं॒ तव॑ ने॒ष्ट्रं त्वम॒ग्निदृ॑ताय॒तः तव॑ प्रशा॒स्त्रं त्वम॑ध्वरीयसि ब्र॒ह्मा चासि॑ गृ॒हप॑तिश्च नो॒ दमे॑
verses.transliteration: távāgne hotráṃ táva potrám r̥tvíyaṃ  táva neṣṭráṃ tvám agníd r̥tāyatáḥ  táva praśāstráṃ tvám adhvarīyasi  brahmā́ cā́si gr̥hápatiś ca no dáme

translation.text: Thine is the Herald's task and Cleanser's duly timed; Leader art thou, and Kindler for the pious man. Thou art Director, thou the ministering Priest: thou art the Brahman, Lord and Master in our home.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वम॑ग्न॒ इन्द्रो॑ वृष॒भः स॒ताम॑सि॒ त्वं विष्णु॑रुरुगा॒यो न॑म॒स्यः॑ त्वं ब्र॒ह्मा र॑यि॒विद्ब्र॑ह्मणस्पते॒ त्वं वि॑धर्तः सचसे॒ पुरं॑ध्या
verses.transliteration: tvám agna índro vr̥ṣabháḥ satā́m asi  tváṃ víṣṇur urugāyó namasyàḥ  tvám brahmā́ rayivíd brahmaṇas pate  tváṃ vidhartaḥ sacase púraṃdhyā

translation.text: Hero of Heroes, Agni! Thou art Indra, thou art Vishṇu of the Mighty Stride, adorable: Thou, Brahmaṇaspati, the Brahman finding wealth: thou, O Sustainer, with thy wisdom tendest us.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वम॑ग्ने॒ राजा॒ वरु॑णो धृ॒तव्र॑त॒स्त्वं मि॒त्रो भ॑वसि द॒स्म ईड्यः॑ त्वम॑र्य॒मा सत्प॑ति॒र्यस्य॑ स॒म्भुजं॒ त्वमंशो॑ वि॒दथे॑ देव भाज॒युः
verses.transliteration: tvám agne rā́jā váruṇo dhr̥távratas  tvám mitró bhavasi dasmá ī́ḍyaḥ  tvám aryamā́ sátpatir yásya sambhújaṃ  tvám áṃśo vidáthe deva bhājayúḥ

translation.text: Agni, thou art King Varuṇa whose laws stand fast; as Mitra, Wonder-Worker, thou must be implored. Aryaman, heroes' Lord, art thou, enrich ing all, and liberal Anṣa in the synod, O thou God.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वम॑ग्ने॒ त्वष्टा॑ विध॒ते सु॒वीर्यं॒ तव॒ ग्नावो॑ मित्रमहः सजा॒त्य॑म् त्वमा॑शु॒हेमा॑ ररिषे॒ स्वश्व्यं॒ त्वं न॒रां शर्धो॑ असि पुरू॒वसुः॑
verses.transliteration: tvám agne tváṣṭā vidhaté suvī́ryaṃ  táva gnā́vo mitramahaḥ sajātyàm  tvám āśuhémā rariṣe sváśvyaṃ  tváṃ narā́ṃ śárdho asi purūvásuḥ

translation.text: Thou givest strength, as Tvashṭar, to the worshipper: thou wielding Mitra's power hast kinship with the Dames. Thou, urging thy fleet coursers, givest noble steeds: a host of heroes art thou with great store of wealth.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वम॑ग्ने रु॒द्रो असु॑रो म॒हो दि॒वस्त्वं शर्धो॒ मारु॑तं पृ॒क्ष ई॑शिषे त्वं वातै॑ररु॒णैर्या॑सि शंग॒यस्त्वं पू॒षा वि॑ध॒तः पा॑सि॒ नु त्मना॑
verses.transliteration: tvám agne rudró ásuro mahó divás  tváṃ śárdho mā́rutam pr̥kṣá īśiṣe  tváṃ vā́tair aruṇaír yāsi śaṃgayás  tvám pūṣā́ vidhatáḥ pāsi nú tmánā

translation.text: Rudra art thou, the Asura of mighty heaven: thou art the Maruts' host, thou art the Lord of food, Thou goest with red winds: bliss hast thou in thine home. As Pûshan thou thyself protectest worshippers.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वम॑ग्ने द्रविणो॒दा अ॑रं॒कृते॒ त्वं दे॒वः स॑वि॒ता र॑त्न॒धा अ॑सि त्वं भगो॑ नृपते॒ वस्व॑ ईशिषे॒ त्वं पा॒युर्दमे॒ यस्तेऽवि॑धत्
verses.transliteration: tvám agne draviṇodā́ araṃkŕ̥te  tváṃ deváḥ savitā́ ratnadhā́ asi  tvám bhágo nr̥pate vásva īśiṣe  tvám pāyúr dáme yás té 'vidhat

translation.text: Giver of wealth art thou to him who honours thee; thou art God Savitar, granter of precious things. As Bhaga, Lord of men! thou rulest over wealth, and guardest in his house him who hath served thee well.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वाम॑ग्ने॒ दम॒ आ वि॒श्पतिं॒ विश॒स्त्वां राजा॑नं सुवि॒दत्र॑मृञ्जते त्वं विश्वा॑नि स्वनीक पत्यसे॒ त्वं स॒हस्रा॑णि श॒ता दश॒ प्रति॑
verses.transliteration: tvā́m agne dáma ā́ viśpátiṃ víśas  tvā́ṃ rā́jānaṃ suvidátram r̥ñjate  tváṃ víśvāni svanīka patyase  tváṃ sahásrāṇi śatā́ dáśa práti

translation.text: To thee, the people's Lord within the house, the folk press forward to their King most graciously inclined. Lord of the lovely look, all things belong to thee: ten, hundred, yea, a thousand are outweighed by thee.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वाम॑ग्ने पि॒तर॑मि॒ष्टिभि॒र्नर॒स्त्वां भ्रा॒त्राय॒ शम्या॑ तनू॒रुच॑म् त्वं पु॒त्रो भ॑वसि॒ यस्तेऽवि॑ध॒त्त्वं सखा॑ सु॒शेवः॑ पास्या॒धृषः॑
verses.transliteration: tvā́m agne pitáram iṣṭíbhir náras  tvā́m bhrātrā́ya śámyā tanūrúcam  tvám putró bhavasi yás té 'vidhat  tváṃ sákhā suśévaḥ pāsy ādhŕ̥ṣaḥ

translation.text: Agni, men seek thee as a Father with their prayers, win thee, bright-formed, to brotherhood with holy act. Thou art a Son to him who duly worships thee, and as a trusty Friend thou guardest from attack.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वम॑ग्न ऋ॒भुरा॒के न॑म॒स्य१॒॑स्त्वं वाज॑स्य क्षु॒मतो॑ रा॒य ई॑शिषे त्वं वि भा॒स्यनु॑ दक्षि दा॒वने॒ त्वं वि॒शिक्षु॑रसि य॒ज्ञमा॒तनिः॑
verses.transliteration: tvám agna r̥bhúr āké namasyàs  tváṃ vā́jasya kṣumáto rāyá īśiṣe  tváṃ ví bhāsy ánu dakṣi dāváne  tváṃ viśíkṣur asi yajñám ātániḥ

translation.text: A R̥ibhu art thou, Agni, near to be adored thou art the Sovran Lord of foodful spoil and wealth. Thou shinest brightly forth, thou burnest to bestow: pervading sacrifice, thou lendest us thine help.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वम॑ग्ने॒ अदि॑तिर्देव दा॒शुषे॒ त्वं होत्रा॒ भार॑ती वर्धसे गि॒रा त्वमिळा॑ श॒तहि॑मासि॒ दक्ष॑से॒ त्वं वृ॑त्र॒हा व॑सुपते॒ सर॑स्वती
verses.transliteration: tvám agne áditir deva dāśúṣe  tváṃ hótrā bhā́ratī vardhase girā́  tvám íḷā śatáhimāsi dákṣase  tváṃ vr̥trahā́ vasupate sárasvatī

translation.text: Thou, God, art Aditi to him who offers gifts: thou, Hotrâ Bhâratî, art strengthened by the song. Thou art the hundred-wintered Iḷâ to give strength, Lord of Wealth! Vr̥itra-slayer and Sarasvatî.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वम॑ग्ने॒ सुभृ॑त उत्त॒मं वय॒स्तव॑ स्पा॒र्हे वर्ण॒ आ सं॒दृशि॒ श्रियः॑ त्वं वाजः॑ प्र॒तर॑णो बृ॒हन्न॑सि॒ त्वं र॒यिर्ब॑हु॒लो वि॒श्वत॑स्पृ॒थुः
verses.transliteration: tvám agne súbhr̥ta uttamáṃ váyas  táva spārhé várṇa ā́ saṃdŕ̥śi śríyaḥ  tváṃ vā́jaḥ pratáraṇo br̥hánn asi  tváṃ rayír bahuló viśvátas pr̥thúḥ

translation.text: Thou, Agni, cherished well, art highest vital power; in thy delightful hue are glories visible. Thou art the lofty might that furthers each design: thou art wealth manifold, diffused on every side.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वाम॑ग्न आदि॒त्यास॑ आ॒स्यं१॒॑ त्वां जि॒ह्वां शुच॑यश्चक्रिरे कवे त्वां रा॑ति॒षाचो॑ अध्व॒रेषु॑ सश्चिरे॒ त्वे दे॒वा ह॒विर॑द॒न्त्याहु॑तम्
verses.transliteration: tvā́m agna ādityā́sa āsyàṃ  tvā́ṃ jihvā́ṃ śúcayaś cakrire kave  tvā́ṃ rātiṣā́co adhvaréṣu saścire  tvé devā́ havír adanty ā́hutam

translation.text: Thee, Agni, have the Âdityas taken as their mouth; the Bright Ones have made thee, O Sage, to be their tongue. They who love offerings cling to thee at solemn rites: by thee the Gods devour the duly offered food.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वे अ॑ग्ने॒ विश्वे॑ अ॒मृता॑सो अ॒द्रुह॑ आ॒सा दे॒वा ह॒विर॑द॒न्त्याहु॑तम् त्वया॒ मर्ता॑सः स्वदन्त आसु॒तिं त्वं गर्भो॑ वी॒रुधां॑ जज्ञिषे॒ शुचिः॑
verses.transliteration: tvé agne víśve amŕ̥tāso adrúhaḥ-  āsā́ devā́ havír adanty ā́hutam  tváyā mártāsaḥ svadanta āsutíṃ  tváṃ gárbho vīrúdhāṃ jajñiṣe śúciḥ

translation.text: By thee, O Agni, all the Immortal guileless Gods cat with thy mouth the oblation that is offered them. By thee do mortal men give sweetness to their drink. Bright art thou born, the embryo of the plants of earth.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वं तान्त्सं च॒ प्रति॑ चासि म॒ज्मनाग्ने॑ सुजात॒ प्र च॑ देव रिच्यसे पृ॒क्षो यदत्र॑ महि॒ना वि ते॒ भुव॒दनु॒ द्यावा॑पृथि॒वी रोद॑सी उ॒भे
verses.transliteration: tváṃ tā́n sáṃ ca práti cāsi majmánā-  -ágne sujāta prá ca deva ricyase  pr̥kṣó yád átra mahinā́ ví te bhúvad  ánu dyā́vāpr̥thivī́ ródasī ubhé

translation.text: With these thou art united, Agni; yea thou, God of noble birth, surpassest them in majesty, Which, through the power of good, here spreads abroad from thee, diffused through both the worlds, throughout the earth and heaven.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ये स्तो॒तृभ्यो॒ गोअ॑ग्रा॒मश्व॑पेशस॒मग्ने॑ रा॒तिमु॑पसृ॒जन्ति॑ सू॒रयः॑ अ॒स्माञ्च॒ ताँश्च॒ प्र हि नेषि॒ वस्य॒ आ बृ॒हद्व॑देम वि॒दथे॑ सु॒वीराः॑
verses.transliteration: yé stotŕ̥bhyo góagrām áśvapeśasam  ágne rātím upasr̥jánti sūráyaḥ  asmā́ñ ca tā́ṃś ca prá hí néṣi vásya ā́  br̥hád vadema vidáthe suvī́rāḥ

translation.text: The princely worshippers who send to those who sing thy praise, O Agni, guerdon graced with kine and steeds,– Lead thou both these and us forward to higher bliss. With brave men in the assembly may we speak aloud.

verses.sanskrit_deva: य॒ज्ञेन॑ वर्धत जा॒तवे॑दसम॒ग्निं य॑जध्वं ह॒विषा॒ तना॑ गि॒रा स॒मि॒धा॒नं सु॑प्र॒यसं॒ स्व॑र्णरं द्यु॒क्षं होता॑रं वृ॒जने॑षु धू॒र्षद॑म्
verses.transliteration: yajñéna vardhata jātávedasam  agníṃ yajadhvaṃ havíṣā tánā girā́  samidhānáṃ suprayásaṃ svàrṇaraṃ  dyukṣáṃ hótāraṃ vr̥jáneṣu dhūrṣádam

translation.text: WITH sacrifice exalt Agni who knows all life; worship him 'with oblation and the song of praise, Well kindled, nobly fed; heaven's Lord, Celestial Priest, who labours at the pole where deeds of might are done.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒भि त्वा॒ नक्ती॑रु॒षसो॑ ववाशि॒रेऽग्ने॑ व॒त्सं न स्वस॑रेषु धे॒नवः॑ दि॒व इ॒वेद॑र॒तिर्मानु॑षा यु॒गा क्षपो॑ भासि पुरुवार सं॒यतः॑
verses.transliteration: abhí tvā náktīr uṣáso vavāśire-  -ágne vatsáṃ ná svásareṣu dhenávaḥ  divá ivéd aratír mā́nuṣā yugā́  kṣápo bhāsi puruvāra saṃyátaḥ

translation.text: At night and morning, Agni, have they called to thee, like milch-kine in their stalls lowing to meet their young. As messenger of heaven thou lightest all night long the families of men. Thou Lord of precious boons.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तं दे॒वा बु॒ध्ने रज॑सः सु॒दंस॑सं दि॒वस्पृ॑थि॒व्योर॑र॒तिं न्ये॑रिरे रथ॑मिव॒ वेद्यं॑ शु॒क्रशो॑चिषम॒ग्निं मि॒त्रं न क्षि॒तिषु॑ प्र॒शंस्य॑म्
verses.transliteration: táṃ devā́ budhné rájasaḥ sudáṃsasaṃ  diváspr̥thivyór aratíṃ ny èrire  rátham iva védyaṃ śukráśociṣam  agním mitráṃ ná kṣitíṣu praśáṃsyam

translation.text: Him have the Gods established at the region's base, doer of wondrous deeds, Herald of heaven and earth; Like a most famous car, Agni the purely bright, like Mitra. to be glorified among the folk.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तमु॒क्षमा॑णं॒ रज॑सि॒ स्व आ दमे॑ च॒न्द्रमि॑व सु॒रुचं॑ ह्वा॒र आ द॑धुः पृश्न्याः॑ पत॒रं चि॒तय॑न्तम॒क्षभिः॑ पा॒थो न पा॒युं जन॑सी उ॒भे अनु॑
verses.transliteration: tám ukṣámāṇaṃ rájasi svá ā́ dáme  candrám iva surúcaṃ hvārá ā́ dadhuḥ  pŕ̥śnyāḥ pataráṃ citáyantam akṣábhiḥ  pāthó ná pāyúṃ jánasī ubhé ánu

translation.text: Him have they set in his own dwelling, in the vault, like the Moon waxing, fulgent, in the realm of air. Bird of the firmament, observant with his eyes, guard of the place as 'twere, looking to Gods and men.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स होता॒ विश्वं॒ परि॑ भूत्वध्व॒रं तमु॑ ह॒व्यैर्मनु॑ष ऋञ्जते गि॒रा हि॒रि॒शि॒प्रो वृ॑धसा॒नासु॒ जर्भु॑र॒द्द्यौर्न स्तृभि॑श्चितय॒द्रोद॑सी॒ अनु॑
verses.transliteration: sá hótā víśvam pári bhūtv adhvaráṃ  tám u havyaír mánuṣa r̥ñjate girā́  hiriśipró vr̥dhasānā́su járbhurad  dyaúr ná stŕ̥bhiś citayad ródasī ánu

translation.text: May he as Priest encompass all the sacrifice. men throng to him with offerings and with hymns of praise. Raging with jaws of gold among the growing plants, like heaven with all the stars, he quickens earth and sky.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स नो॑ रे॒वत्स॑मिधा॒नः स्व॒स्तये॑ संदद॒स्वान्र॒यिम॒स्मासु॑ दीदिहि आ नः॑ कृणुष्व सुवि॒ताय॒ रोद॑सी॒ अग्ने॑ ह॒व्या मनु॑षो देव वी॒तये॑
verses.transliteration: sá no revát samidhānáḥ svastáye  saṃdadasvā́n rayím asmā́su dīdihi  ā́ naḥ kr̥ṇuṣva suvitā́ya ródasī  ágne havyā́ mánuṣo deva vītáye

translation.text: Such as thou art, brilliantly kindled for our weal, a liberal giver, send us riches in thy shine, For our advantage, Agni, God, bring Heaven and Earth hither that they may taste oblation brought by man.

verses.sanskrit_deva: दा नो॑ अग्ने बृह॒तो दाः स॑ह॒स्रिणो॑ दु॒रो न वाजं॒ श्रुत्या॒ अपा॑ वृधि प्राची॒ द्यावा॑पृथि॒वी ब्रह्म॑णा कृधि॒ स्व१॒॑र्ण शु॒क्रमु॒षसो॒ वि दि॑द्युतः
verses.transliteration: dā́ no agne br̥ható dā́ḥ sahasríṇo  duró ná vā́jaṃ śrútyā ápā vr̥dhi  prā́cī dyā́vāpr̥thivī́ bráhmaṇā kr̥dhi  svàr ṇá śukrám uṣáso ví didyutaḥ

translation.text: Agni, give us great wealth, give riches thousandfold. unclose to us, like doors, strength that shall bring renown. Make Heaven and Earth propitious through the power of prayer, and like the sky's bright sheen let mornings beam on us.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स इ॑धा॒न उ॒षसो॒ राम्या॒ अनु॒ स्व१॒॑र्ण दी॑देदरु॒षेण॑ भा॒नुना॑ होत्रा॑भिर॒ग्निर्मनु॑षः स्वध्व॒रो राजा॑ वि॒शामति॑थि॒श्चारु॑रा॒यवे॑
verses.transliteration: sá idhāná uṣáso rā́myā ánu  svàr ṇá dīded aruṣéṇa bhānúnā  hótrābhir agnír mánuṣaḥ svadhvaró  rā́jā viśā́m átithiś cā́rur āyáve

translation.text: Enkindled night by night at every morning's dawn, may he shine forth with red flame like the realm of light,– Agni adored in beauteous rites with lauds of men, fair guest of living man and King of all our folk.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ए॒वा नो॑ अग्ने अ॒मृते॑षु पूर्व्य॒ धीष्पी॑पाय बृ॒हद्दि॑वेषु॒ मानु॑षा दुहा॑ना धे॒नुर्वृ॒जने॑षु का॒रवे॒ त्मना॑ श॒तिनं॑ पुरु॒रूप॑मि॒षणि॑
verses.transliteration: evā́ no agne amŕ̥teṣu pūrvya  dhī́ṣ pīpāya br̥háddiveṣu mā́nuṣā  dúhānā dhenúr vr̥jáneṣu kāráve  tmánā śatínam pururū́pam iṣáṇi

translation.text: Song chanted by us men, O Agni, Ancient One, has swelled unto the deathless Gods in lofty heaven- A milch-cow yielding to the singer in the rites wealth manifold, in hundreds, even as he wills.

verses.sanskrit_deva: व॒यम॑ग्ने॒ अर्व॑ता वा सु॒वीर्यं॒ ब्रह्म॑णा वा चितयेमा॒ जनाँ॒ अति॑ अ॒स्माकं॑ द्यु॒म्नमधि॒ पञ्च॑ कृ॒ष्टिषू॒च्चा स्व१॒॑र्ण शु॑शुचीत दु॒ष्टर॑म्
verses.transliteration: vayám agne árvatā vā suvī́ryam  bráhmaṇā vā citayemā jánām̐ áti  asmā́kaṃ dyumnám ádhi páñca kr̥ṣṭíṣu-  -uccā́ svàr ṇá śuśucīta duṣṭáram

translation.text: Agni, may we show forth our valour with the steed or with the power of prayer beyond all other men; And over the Five Races let our glory shine high like the realm of light and unsurpassable.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स नो॑ बोधि सहस्य प्र॒शंस्यो॒ यस्मि॑न्त्सुजा॒ता इ॒षय॑न्त सू॒रयः॑ यम॑ग्ने य॒ज्ञमु॑प॒यन्ति॑ वा॒जिनो॒ नित्ये॑ तो॒के दी॑दि॒वांसं॒ स्वे दमे॑
verses.transliteration: sá no bodhi sahasya praśáṃsyo  yásmin sujātā́ iṣáyanta sūráyaḥ  yám agne yajñám upayánti vājíno  nítye toké dīdivā́ṃsaṃ své dáme

translation.text: Such, Conqueror! be to us, be worthy of our praise, thou for whom princes nobly born exert themselves; Whose sacrifice the strong seek, Agni, when it shines for never-failing offspring in thine own abode.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उ॒भया॑सो जातवेदः स्याम ते स्तो॒तारो॑ अग्ने सू॒रय॑श्च॒ शर्म॑णि वस्वो॑ रा॒यः पु॑रुश्च॒न्द्रस्य॒ भूय॑सः प्र॒जाव॑तः स्वप॒त्यस्य॑ शग्धि नः
verses.transliteration: ubháyāso jātavedaḥ syāma te  stotā́ro agne sūráyaś ca śármaṇi  vásvo rāyáḥ puruścandrásya bhū́yasaḥ  prajā́vataḥ svapatyásya śagdhi naḥ

translation.text: Knower of all that lives, O Agni may we both, singers of praise and chiefs, be in thy keeping still. Help us to wealth exceeding good and glorious, abundant, rich in children and their progeny.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ये स्तो॒तृभ्यो॒ गोअ॑ग्रा॒मश्व॑पेशस॒मग्ने॑ रा॒तिमु॑पसृ॒जन्ति॑ सू॒रयः॑ अ॒स्माञ्च॒ ताँश्च॒ प्र हि नेषि॒ वस्य॒ आ बृ॒हद्व॑देम वि॒दथे॑ सु॒वीराः॑
verses.transliteration: yé stotŕ̥bhyo góagrām áśvapeśasam  ágne rātím upasr̥jánti sūráyaḥ  asmā́ñ ca tā́ṃś ca prá hí néṣi vásya ā́  br̥hád vadema vidáthe suvī́rāḥ

translation.text: The princely worshippers who send to those who sing thy praise, O Agni, guerdon, graced with kine and steeds,– Lead thou both these and us forward to higher bliss. With brave men in the assembly may we speak aloud.

verses.sanskrit_deva: समि॑द्धो अ॒ग्निर्निहि॑तः पृथि॒व्यां प्र॒त्यङ्विश्वा॑नि॒ भुव॑नान्यस्थात् होता॑ पाव॒कः प्र॒दिवः॑ सुमे॒धा दे॒वो दे॒वान्य॑जत्व॒ग्निरर्ह॑न्
verses.transliteration: sámiddho agnír níhitaḥ pr̥thivyā́m  pratyáṅ víśvāni bhúvanāny asthāt  hótā pāvakáḥ pradívaḥ sumedhā́ḥ-  devó devā́n yajatv agnír árhan

translation.text: AGNI is set upon the earth well kindled; he standeth in the presence of all beings. Wise, ancient, God, the Priest and Purifier, let Agni serve the Gods for he is worthy.

verses.sanskrit_deva: नरा॒शंसः॒ प्रति॒ धामा॑न्य॒ञ्जन्ति॒स्रो दिवः॒ प्रति॑ म॒ह्ना स्व॒र्चिः घृ॒त॒प्रुषा॒ मन॑सा ह॒व्यमु॒न्दन्मू॒र्धन्य॒ज्ञस्य॒ सम॑नक्तु दे॒वान्
verses.transliteration: nárāśáṃsaḥ práti dhā́māny añján  tisró dívaḥ práti mahnā́ svarcíḥ  ghr̥taprúṣā mánasā havyám undán  mūrdhán yajñásya sám anaktu devā́n

translation.text: May Narâṣansa lighting up the chambers, bright in his majesty through threefold heaven, Steeping the gift with oil diffusing purpose, bedew the Gods at chiefest time of worship.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ई॒ळि॒तो अ॑ग्ने॒ मन॑सा नो॒ अर्ह॑न्दे॒वान्य॑क्षि॒ मानु॑षा॒त्पूर्वो॑ अ॒द्य स आ व॑ह म॒रुतां॒ शर्धो॒ अच्यु॑त॒मिन्द्रं॑ नरो बर्हि॒षदं॑ यजध्वम्
verses.transliteration: īḷitó agne mánasā no árhan  devā́n yakṣi mā́nuṣāt pū́rvo adyá  sá ā́ vaha marútāṃ śárdho ácyutam  índraṃ naro barhiṣádaṃ yajadhvam

translation.text: Adored in heart, as is thy right, O Agni, serve the Gods first to-day before the mortal. Bring thou the Marut host. Ye men do worship to Indra seated on the grass, eternal.

verses.sanskrit_deva: देव॑ बर्हि॒र्वर्ध॑मानं सु॒वीरं॑ स्ती॒र्णं रा॒ये सु॒भरं॒ वेद्य॒स्याम् घृ॒तेना॒क्तं व॑सवः सीदते॒दं विश्वे॑ देवा आदित्या य॒ज्ञिया॑सः
verses.transliteration: déva barhir várdhamānaṃ suvī́raṃ  stīrṇáṃ rāyé subháraṃ védy asyā́m  ghr̥ténāktáṃ vasavaḥ sīdatedáṃ  víśve devā ādityā yajñíyāsaḥ

translation.text: O Grass divine, increasing, rich in heroes, strewn for wealth' sake, well laid upon this altar,– On this bedewed with oil sit ye, O Vasus, sit all ye Gods, ye Holy, ye Âdityas.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वि श्र॑यन्तामुर्वि॒या हू॒यमा॑ना॒ द्वारो॑ दे॒वीः सु॑प्राय॒णा नमो॑भिः व्यच॑स्वती॒र्वि प्र॑थन्तामजु॒र्या वर्णं॑ पुना॒ना य॒शसं॑ सु॒वीर॑म्
verses.transliteration: ví śrayantām urviyā́ hūyámānāḥ-  dvā́ro devī́ḥ suprāyaṇā́ námobhiḥ  vyácasvatīr ví prathantām ajuryā́ḥ-  várṇam punānā́ yaśásaṃ suvī́ram

translation.text: Wide be the Doors, the Goddesses, thrown open, easy to pass, invoked, through adorations, Let them unfold, expansive, everlasting, that sanctify the class famed, rich in heroes.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सा॒ध्वपां॑सि स॒नता॑ न उक्षि॒ते उ॒षासा॒नक्ता॑ व॒य्ये॑व रण्वि॒ते तन्तुं॑ त॒तं सं॒वय॑न्ती समी॒ची य॒ज्ञस्य॒ पेशः॑ सु॒दुघे॒ पय॑स्वती
verses.transliteration: sādhv ápāṃsi sanátā na ukṣité  uṣā́sānáktā vayyèva raṇvité  tántuṃ tatáṃ saṃváyantī samīcī́  yajñásya péśaḥ sudúghe páyasvatī

translation.text: Good work for us, the glorious Night and Morning, like female weavers, waxen from aforetime, Yielders of rich milk, interweave in concert the long-extended thread, the web of worship.

verses.sanskrit_deva: दैव्या॒ होता॑रा प्रथ॒मा वि॒दुष्ट॑र ऋ॒जु य॑क्षतः॒ समृ॒चा व॒पुष्ट॑रा दे॒वान्यज॑न्तावृतु॒था सम॑ञ्जतो॒ नाभा॑ पृथि॒व्या अधि॒ सानु॑षु त्रि॒षु
verses.transliteration: daívyā hótārā prathamā́ vidúṣṭarā-  r̥jú yakṣataḥ sám r̥cā́ vapúṣṭarā  devā́n yájantāv r̥tuthā́ sám añjato  nā́bhā pr̥thivyā́ ádhi sā́nuṣu triṣú

translation.text: Let the two heavenly Heralds, first, most wise, most fair, present oblation duly with the sacred verse, Worshipping God at ordered seasons decking them at three high places at the centre of the earth.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सर॑स्वती सा॒धय॑न्ती॒ धियं॑ न॒ इळा॑ दे॒वी भार॑ती वि॒श्वतू॑र्तिः ति॒स्रो दे॒वीः स्व॒धया॑ ब॒र्हिरेदमच्छि॑द्रं पान्तु शर॒णं नि॒षद्य॑
verses.transliteration: sárasvatī sādháyantī dhíyaṃ naḥ-  íḷā devī́ bhā́ratī viśvátūrtiḥ  tisró devī́ḥ svadháyā barhír édám  áchidram pāntu śaraṇáṃ niṣádya

translation.text: Sarasvatî who perfects our devotion, Iḷâ divine, Bhâratî all surpassing,– Three Goddesses, with power inherent, seated, protect this holy Grass, our flawless refuge!

verses.sanskrit_deva: पि॒शङ्ग॑रूपः सु॒भरो॑ वयो॒धाः श्रु॒ष्टी वी॒रो जा॑यते दे॒वका॑मः प्र॒जां त्वष्टा॒ वि ष्य॑तु॒ नाभि॑म॒स्मे अथा॑ दे॒वाना॒मप्ये॑तु॒ पाथः॑
verses.transliteration: piśáṅgarūpaḥ subháro vayodhā́ḥ  śruṣṭī́ vīró jāyate devákāmaḥ  prajā́ṃ tváṣṭā ví ṣyatu nā́bhim asmé  áthā devā́nām ápy etu pā́thaḥ

translation.text: Born is the pious hero swift of hearing, like gold in hue, well formed, and full of vigour. May Tvashṭar lengthen our line and kindred, and may they reach the place which Gods inhabit.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वन॒स्पति॑रवसृ॒जन्नुप॑ स्थाद॒ग्निर्ह॒विः सू॑दयाति॒ प्र धी॒भिः त्रिधा॒ सम॑क्तं नयतु प्रजा॒नन्दे॒वेभ्यो॒ दैव्यः॑ शमि॒तोप॑ ह॒व्यम्
verses.transliteration: vánaspátir avasr̥jánn úpa sthād  agnír havíḥ sūdayāti prá dhībhíḥ  trídhā sámaktaṃ nayatu prajānán  devébhyo daívyaḥ śamitópa havyám

translation.text: Vanaspati shall stand anear and start us, and Agni with his arts prepare oblation. Let the skilled heavenly Immolator forward unto the Gods the offering thrice anointed.

verses.sanskrit_deva: घृ॒तं मि॑मिक्षे घृ॒तम॑स्य॒ योनि॑र्घृ॒ते श्रि॒तो घृ॒तम्व॑स्य॒ धाम॑ अ॒नु॒ष्व॒धमा व॑ह मा॒दय॑स्व॒ स्वाहा॑कृतं वृषभ वक्षि ह॒व्यम्
verses.transliteration: ghr̥tám mimikṣe ghr̥tám asya yónir  ghr̥té śritó ghr̥tám v asya dhā́ma  anuṣvadhám ā́ vaha mādáyasva  svā́hākr̥taṃ vr̥ṣabha vakṣi havyám

translation.text: Oil has been mixt: oil is his habitation. In oil he rests: oil is his proper province. Come as thy wont is: O thou Steer, rejoice thee; bear off the oblation duly consecrated.

verses.sanskrit_deva: हु॒वे वः॑ सु॒द्योत्मा॑नं सुवृ॒क्तिं वि॒शाम॒ग्निमति॑थिं सुप्र॒यस॑म् मि॒त्र इ॑व॒ यो दि॑धि॒षाय्यो॒ भूद्दे॒व आदे॑वे॒ जने॑ जा॒तवे॑दाः
verses.transliteration: huvé vaḥ sudyótmānaṃ suvr̥ktíṃ  viśā́m agním átithiṃ suprayásam  mitrá iva yó didhiṣā́yyo bhū́d  devá ā́deve jáne jātávedāḥ

translation.text: FOR you I call theglorious refulgent Agni, the guest of men, rich in oblations Whom all must strive to win even as a lover, God among godly people, Jâtavedas.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इ॒मं वि॒धन्तो॑ अ॒पां स॒धस्थे॑ द्वि॒ताद॑धु॒र्भृग॑वो वि॒क्ष्वा॒३॒॑योः ए॒ष विश्वा॑न्य॒भ्य॑स्तु॒ भूमा॑ दे॒वाना॑म॒ग्निर॑र॒तिर्जी॒राश्वः॑
verses.transliteration: imáṃ vidhánto apā́ṃ sadhásthe  dvitā́dadhur bhŕ̥gavo vikṣv ā̀yóḥ  eṣá víśvāny abhy àstu bhū́mā  devā́nām agnír aratír jīrā́śvaḥ

translation.text: Bhr̥igus who served him in the home of waters set him of old in houses of the living. Over all worlds let Agni be the Sovran, the messenger of Gods with rapid coursers.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒ग्निं दे॒वासो॒ मानु॑षीषु वि॒क्षु प्रि॒यं धुः॑ क्षे॒ष्यन्तो॒ न मि॒त्रम् स दी॑दयदुश॒तीरूर्म्या॒ आ द॒क्षाय्यो॒ यो दास्व॑ते॒ दम॒ आ
verses.transliteration: agníṃ devā́so mā́nuṣīṣu vikṣú  priyáṃ dhuḥ kṣeṣyánto ná mitrám  sá dīdayad uśatī́r ū́rmyā~ā́  dakṣā́yyo yó dā́svate dáma ā́

translation.text: Among the tribes of men the Gods placed Agni as a dear Friend when they would dwell among them. Against the longing nights may he shine brightly, and show the offerer in the house his vigour.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒स्य र॒ण्वा स्वस्ये॑व पु॒ष्टिः संदृ॑ष्टिरस्य हिया॒नस्य॒ दक्षोः॑ वि यो भरि॑भ्र॒दोष॑धीषु जि॒ह्वामत्यो॒ न रथ्यो॑ दोधवीति॒ वारा॑न्
verses.transliteration: asyá raṇvā́ svásyeva puṣṭíḥ  sáṃdr̥ṣṭir asya hiyānásya dákṣoḥ  ví yó bháribhrad óṣadhīṣu jihvā́m  átyo ná ráthyo dodhavīti vā́rān

translation.text: Sweet is his growth as of one's own possessions; his look when rushing fain to burn is lovely. He darts his tongue forth, like a harnessed courser who shakes his flowing tail, among the bushes.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ यन्मे॒ अभ्वं॑ व॒नदः॒ पन॑न्तो॒शिग्भ्यो॒ नामि॑मीत॒ वर्ण॑म् स चि॒त्रेण॑ चिकिते॒ रंसु॑ भा॒सा जु॑जु॒र्वाँ यो मुहु॒रा युवा॒ भूत्
verses.transliteration: ā́ yán me ábhvaṃ vanádaḥ pánanta-  -uśígbhyo nā́mimīta várṇam  sá citréṇa cikite ráṃsu bhāsā́  jujurvā́m̐ yó múhur ā́ yúvā bhū́t

translation.text: Since they who honour me have praised my greatness,– he gave, as 'twere, his hue to those who love him. Known is he by his bright delightful splendour, and waxing old renews his youth for ever.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ यो वना॑ तातृषा॒णो न भाति॒ वार्ण प॒था रथ्ये॑व स्वानीत् कृ॒ष्णाध्वा॒ तपू॑ र॒ण्वश्चि॑केत॒ द्यौरि॑व॒ स्मय॑मानो॒ नभो॑भिः
verses.transliteration: ā́ yó vánā tātr̥ṣāṇó ná bhā́ti  vā́r ṇá pathā́ ráthyeva svānīt  kr̥ṣṇā́dhvā tápū raṇváś ciketa  dyaúr iva smáyamāno nábhobhiḥ

translation.text: Like one athirst, he lighteth up the forests; like water down the chariot ways he roareth. On his black path he shines in burning beauty, marked as it were the heaven that smiles through vapour.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स यो व्यस्था॑द॒भि दक्ष॑दु॒र्वीं प॒शुर्नैति॑ स्व॒युरगो॑पाः अ॒ग्निः शो॒चिष्माँ॑ अत॒सान्यु॒ष्णन्कृ॒ष्णव्य॑थिरस्वदय॒न्न भूम॑
verses.transliteration: sá yó vy ásthād abhí dákṣad urvī́m  paśúr naíti svayúr ágopāḥ  agníḥ śocíṣmām̐ atasā́ny uṣṇán  kr̥ṣṇávyathir asvadayan ná bhū́ma

translation.text: Around, consuming the broad earth, he wanders, free roaming like an ox without a herdsman,– Agni refulgent, burning up the bushes, with blackened lines, as though the earth he seasoned.

verses.sanskrit_deva: नू ते॒ पूर्व॒स्याव॑सो॒ अधी॑तौ तृ॒तीये॑ वि॒दथे॒ मन्म॑ शंसि अ॒स्मे अ॑ग्ने सं॒यद्वी॑रं बृ॒हन्तं॑ क्षु॒मन्तं॒ वाजं॑ स्वप॒त्यं र॒यिं दाः॑
verses.transliteration: nū́ te pū́rvasyā́vaso ádhītau  tr̥tī́ye vidáthe mánma śaṃsi  asmé agne saṃyádvīram br̥hántaṃ  kṣumántaṃ vā́jaṃ svapatyáṃ rayíṃ dāḥ

translation.text: I, in remembrance of thine ancient favour have sung my hymn in this our third assembly. O Agni, give us wealth with store of heroes and mighty strength in food and noble offspring.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वया॒ यथा॑ गृत्सम॒दासो॑ अग्ने॒ गुहा॑ व॒न्वन्त॒ उप॑राँ अ॒भि ष्युः सु॒वीरा॑सो अभिमाति॒षाहः॒ स्मत्सू॒रिभ्यो॑ गृण॒ते तद्वयो॑ धाः
verses.transliteration: tváyā yáthā gr̥tsamadā́so agne  gúhā vanvánta úparām̐ abhí ṣyúḥ  suvī́rāso abhimātiṣā́haḥ  smát sūríbhyo gr̥ṇaté tád váyo dhāḥ

translation.text: May the Gr̥itsamadas, serving in secret, through thee, O Agni, overcome their neighbours, Rich in good heroes and subduing foemen. That vital power give thou to chiefs and singers.

verses.sanskrit_deva: होता॑जनिष्ट॒ चेत॑नः पि॒ता पि॒तृभ्य॑ ऊ॒तये॑ प्र॒यक्ष॒ञ्जेन्यं॒ वसु॑ श॒केम॑ वा॒जिनो॒ यम॑म्
verses.transliteration: hótājaniṣṭa cétanaḥ  pitā́ pitŕ̥bhya ūtáye  prayákṣañ jényaṃ vásu  śakéma vājíno yámam

translation.text: HERALD and teacher was he born, a guardian for our patrons' help, Earner by rites of noble wealth. That Strong One may we grasp and guide;

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ यस्मि॑न्त्स॒प्त र॒श्मय॑स्त॒ता य॒ज्ञस्य॑ ने॒तरि॑ म॒नु॒ष्वद्दैव्य॑मष्ट॒मं पोता॒ विश्वं॒ तदि॑न्वति
verses.transliteration: ā́ yásmin saptá raśmáyas  tatā́ yajñásya netári  manuṣvád daívyam aṣṭamám  pótā víśvaṃ tád invati

translation.text: In whom, Leader of sacrifice, the seven reins, far extended, meet; Who furthers, man-like, eighth in place, as Cleanser, all the work divine.

verses.sanskrit_deva: द॒ध॒न्वे वा॒ यदी॒मनु॒ वोच॒द्ब्रह्मा॑णि॒ वेरु॒ तत् परि॒ विश्वा॑नि॒ काव्या॑ ने॒मिश्च॒क्रमि॑वाभवत्
verses.transliteration: dadhanvé vā yád īm ánu  vócad bráhmāṇi vér u tát  pári víśvāni kā́vyā  nemíś cakrám ivābhavat

translation.text: When swift he follows this behest, bird-like he chants the holy prayers. He holds all knowledge in his grasp even as the felly rounds the wheel.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सा॒कं हि शुचि॑ना॒ शुचिः॑ प्रशा॒स्ता क्रतु॒नाज॑नि वि॒द्वाँ अ॑स्य व्र॒ता ध्रु॒वा व॒या इ॒वानु॑ रोहते
verses.transliteration: sākáṃ hí śúcinā śúciḥ  praśāstā́ krátunā́jani  vidvā́m̐ asya vratā́ dhruvā́  vayā́ ivā́nu rohate

translation.text: Together with pure mental power, pure, as Director, was he born. Skilled in his own unchanging laws he waxes like the growing boughs.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ता अ॑स्य॒ वर्ण॑मा॒युवो॒ नेष्टुः॑ सचन्त धे॒नवः॑ कु॒वित्ति॒सृभ्य॒ आ वरं॒ स्वसा॑रो॒ या इ॒दं य॒युः
verses.transliteration: tā́ asya várṇam āyúvo  néṣṭuḥ sacanta dhenávaḥ  kuvít tisŕ̥bhya ā́ váraṃ  svásāro yā́ idáṃ yayúḥ

translation.text: Clothing them in his hues, the kine of him the Leader wait on him. Is he not better than the Three, the Sisters who have come to us?

verses.sanskrit_deva: यदी॑ मा॒तुरुप॒ स्वसा॑ घृ॒तं भर॒न्त्यस्थि॑त तासा॑मध्व॒र्युराग॑तौ॒ यवो॑ वृ॒ष्टीव॑ मोदते
verses.transliteration: yádī mātúr úpa svásā  ghr̥tám bháranty ásthita  tā́sām adhvaryúr ā́gatau  yávo vr̥ṣṭī́va modate

translation.text: When, laden with the holy oil, the Sitster (sic) by the Mother stands, The Priest delights in their approach, as corn at coming of the rain.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स्वः स्वाय॒ धाय॑से कृणु॒तामृ॒त्विगृ॒त्विज॑म् स्तोमं॑ य॒ज्ञं चादरं॑ व॒नेमा॑ ररि॒मा व॒यम्
verses.transliteration: sváḥ svā́ya dhā́yase  kr̥ṇutā́m r̥tvíg r̥tvíjam  stómaṃ yajñáṃ cā́d áraṃ  vanémā rarimā́ vayám

translation.text: For his support let him perform as ministrant his priestly task; Yea, song of praise and sacrifice: we have bestowed, let us obtain.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यथा॑ वि॒द्वाँ अरं॒ कर॒द्विश्वे॑भ्यो यज॒तेभ्यः॑ अ॒यम॑ग्ने॒ त्वे अपि॒ यं य॒ज्ञं च॑कृ॒मा व॒यम्
verses.transliteration: yáthā vidvā́m̐ áraṃ kárad  víśvebhyo yajatébhyaḥ  ayám agne tvé ápi  yáṃ yajñáṃ cakr̥mā́ vayám

translation.text: That so this man well skilled, may pay worship to all the Holy Ones. And, Agni, this our sacrifice which wehave here prepared, to thee.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इ॒मां मे॑ अग्ने स॒मिध॑मि॒मामु॑प॒सदं॑ वनेः इ॒मा उ॒ षु श्रु॑धी॒ गिरः॑
verses.transliteration: imā́m me agne samídham  imā́m upasádaṃ vaneḥ  imā́ u ṣú śrudhī gíraḥ

translation.text: AGNI, accept this flaming brand, this waiting with my prayer on thee: Hear graciously these songs of praise.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒या ते॑ अग्ने विधे॒मोर्जो॑ नपा॒दश्व॑मिष्टे ए॒ना सू॒क्तेन॑ सुजात
verses.transliteration: ayā́ te agne vidhema-  -ū́rjo napād áśvamiṣṭe  enā́ sūkténa sujāta

translation.text: With this hymn let us honour thee, seeker of horses, Son of Strength, With this fair hymn, thou nobly born.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तं त्वा॑ गी॒र्भिर्गिर्व॑णसं द्रविण॒स्युं द्र॑विणोदः स॒प॒र्येम॑ सप॒र्यवः॑
verses.transliteration: táṃ tvā gīrbhír gírvaṇasaṃ  draviṇasyúṃ draviṇodaḥ  saparyéma saparyávaḥ

translation.text: As such, lover of song, with songs, wealth-lover, giver of our wealth! With reverence let us worship thee.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स बो॑धि सू॒रिर्म॒घवा॒ वसु॑पते॒ वसु॑दावन् यु॒यो॒ध्य१॒॑स्मद्द्वेषां॑सि
verses.transliteration: sá bodhi sūrír maghávā  vásupate vásudāvan  yuyodhy àsmád dvéṣāṃsi

translation.text: Be thou for us a liberal Prince, giver and Lord of precious things. Drive those who hate us far away.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स नो॑ वृ॒ष्टिं दि॒वस्परि॒ स नो॒ वाज॑मन॒र्वाण॑म् स नः॑ सह॒स्रिणी॒रिषः॑
verses.transliteration: sá no vr̥ṣṭíṃ divás pári  sá no vā́jam anarvā́ṇam  sá naḥ sahasríṇīr íṣaḥ

translation.text: Such as thou art, give rain from heaven, give strength which no man may resist: Give food exceeding plentiful.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ईळा॑नायाव॒स्यवे॒ यवि॑ष्ठ दूत नो गि॒रा यजि॑ष्ठ होत॒रा ग॑हि
verses.transliteration: ī́ḷānāyāvasyáve  yáviṣṭha dūta no girā́  yájiṣṭha hotar ā́ gahi

translation.text: To him who lauds thee, craving help, most youthful envoy! through our song, Most holy Herald! come thou nigh.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒न्तर्ह्य॑ग्न॒ ईय॑से वि॒द्वाञ्जन्मो॒भया॑ कवे दू॒तो जन्ये॑व॒ मित्र्यः॑
verses.transliteration: antár hy àgna ī́yase  vidvā́ñ jánmobháyā kave  dūtó jányeva mítryaḥ

translation.text: Between both races, Agni, Sage, well skilled thou passest to and fro, As envoy friendly to mankind.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स वि॒द्वाँ आ च॑ पिप्रयो॒ यक्षि॑ चिकित्व आनु॒षक् आ चा॒स्मिन्त्स॑त्सि ब॒र्हिषि॑
verses.transliteration: sá vidvā́m̐ ā́ ca piprayo  yákṣi cikitva ānuṣák  ā́ cāsmín satsi barhíṣi

translation.text: Befriend us thou as knowing all. Sage, duly worship thou the Gods, And seat thee on this sacred grass.

verses.sanskrit_deva: श्रेष्ठं॑ यविष्ठ भार॒ताग्ने॑ द्यु॒मन्त॒मा भ॑र वसो॑ पुरु॒स्पृहं॑ र॒यिम्
verses.transliteration: śréṣṭhaṃ yaviṣṭha bhārata-  -ágne dyumántam ā́ bhara  váso puruspŕ̥haṃ rayím

translation.text: VASU, thou most youthful God, Bharata, Agni, bring us wealth, Excellent, splendid, much-desired.

verses.sanskrit_deva: मा नो॒ अरा॑तिरीशत दे॒वस्य॒ मर्त्य॑स्य च पर्षि॒ तस्या॑ उ॒त द्वि॒षः
verses.transliteration: mā́ no árātir īśata  devásya mártyasya ca  párṣi tásyā utá dviṣáḥ

translation.text: Let no malignity prevail against us, either God's or man's. Save us from this and enmity.

verses.sanskrit_deva: विश्वा॑ उ॒त त्वया॑ व॒यं धारा॑ उद॒न्या॑ इव अति॑ गाहेमहि॒ द्विषः॑
verses.transliteration: víśvā utá tváyā vayáṃ  dhā́rā udanyā̀ iva  áti gāhemahi dvíṣaḥ

translation.text: So through thy favour may we force through all our enemies a way, As 'twere through streaming water-floods.

verses.sanskrit_deva: शुचिः॑ पावक॒ वन्द्योऽग्ने॑ बृ॒हद्वि रो॑चसे त्वं घृ॒तेभि॒राहु॑तः
verses.transliteration: śúciḥ pāvaka vándyaḥ-  -ágne br̥hád ví rocase  tváṃ ghr̥tébhir ā́hutaḥ

translation.text: Thou, Purifier Agni, high shinest forth, bright, adorable, When worshipped with the sacred oil.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वं नो॑ असि भार॒ताग्ने॑ व॒शाभि॑रु॒क्षभिः॑ अ॒ष्टाप॑दीभि॒राहु॑तः
verses.transliteration: tváṃ no asi bhārata-  -ágne vaśā́bhir ukṣábhiḥ  aṣṭā́padībhir ā́hutaḥ

translation.text: Ours art thou, Agni, Bharata, honoured by us with barren cows, With bullocks and with kine in calf

verses.sanskrit_deva: द्र्व॑न्नः स॒र्पिरा॑सुतिः प्र॒त्नो होता॒ वरे॑ण्यः सह॑सस्पु॒त्रो अद्भु॑तः
verses.transliteration: drvànnaḥ sarpírāsutiḥ  pratnó hótā váreṇyaḥ  sáhasas putró ádbhutaḥ

translation.text: Wood-fed, bedewed with sacred oil, ancient, Invoker, excellent, The Son of Strength, the Wonderful.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वा॒ज॒यन्नि॑व॒ नू रथा॒न्योगाँ॑ अ॒ग्नेरुप॑ स्तुहि य॒शस्त॑मस्य मी॒ळ्हुषः॑
verses.transliteration: vājayánn iva nū́ ráthān  yógām̐ agnér úpa stuhi  yaśástamasya mīḷhúṣaḥ

translation.text: Now praise, as one who strives for strength, the harnessing of Agni's car, The liberal, the most splendid One;

verses.sanskrit_deva: यः सु॑नी॒थो द॑दा॒शुषे॑ऽजु॒र्यो ज॒रय॑न्न॒रिम् चारु॑प्रतीक॒ आहु॑तः
verses.transliteration: yáḥ sunīthó dadāśúṣe  -ajuryó jaráyann arím  cā́rupratīka ā́hutaḥ

translation.text: Who, guiding worshippers aright, withers, untouched by age, the foe: When worshipped fair to look upon;

verses.sanskrit_deva: य उ॑ श्रि॒या दमे॒ष्वा दो॒षोषसि॑ प्रश॒स्यते॑ यस्य॑ व्र॒तं न मीय॑ते
verses.transliteration: yá u śriyā́ dámeṣv~ā́  doṣóṣási praśasyáte  yásya vratáṃ ná mī́yate

translation.text: Who for his glory is extolled at eve and morning in our homes, Whose statute is inviolate;

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ यः स्व१॒॑र्ण भा॒नुना॑ चि॒त्रो वि॒भात्य॒र्चिषा॑ अ॒ञ्जा॒नो अ॒जरै॑र॒भि
verses.transliteration: ā́ yáḥ svàr ṇá bhānúnā  citró vibhā́ty arcíṣā  añjānó ajárair abhí

translation.text: Who shines refulgent like the Sun, with brilliance and with fiery flame, Decked with imperishable sheen.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अत्रि॒मनु॑ स्व॒राज्य॑म॒ग्निमु॒क्थानि॑ वावृधुः विश्वा॒ अधि॒ श्रियो॑ दधे
verses.transliteration: átrim ánu svarā́jyam  agním ukthā́ni vāvr̥dhuḥ  víśvā ádhi śríyo dadhe

translation.text: Him Atri, Agni, have our songs Strengthened according to his sway: All glories hath he made his own.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒ग्नेरिन्द्र॑स्य॒ सोम॑स्य दे॒वाना॑मू॒तिभि॑र्व॒यम् अरि॑ष्यन्तः सचेमह्य॒भि ष्या॑म पृतन्य॒तः
verses.transliteration: agnér índrasya sómasya  devā́nām ūtíbhir vayám  áriṣyantaḥ sacemahi-  abhí ṣyāma pr̥tanyatáḥ

translation.text: May we with Agni's, Indra's help, with Soma's, yea, of all the Gods, Uninjured dwell together still, and conquer those who fight with us.

verses.sanskrit_deva: नि होता॑ होतृ॒षद॑ने॒ विदा॑नस्त्वे॒षो दी॑दि॒वाँ अ॑सदत्सु॒दक्षः॑ अद॑ब्धव्रतप्रमति॒र्वसि॑ष्ठः सहस्रम्भ॒रः शुचि॑जिह्वो अ॒ग्निः
verses.transliteration: ní hótā hotr̥ṣádane vídānas  tveṣó dīdivā́m̐ asadat sudákṣaḥ  ádabdhavratapramatir vásiṣṭhaḥ  sahasrambharáḥ śúcijihvo agníḥ

translation.text: ACCUSTOMED to the Herald's place, the Herald hath seated him, bright, splendid, passing mighty, Whose foresight keeps the Law from violation, excellent, pure-tongued, bringing thousands, Agni.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वं दू॒तस्त्वमु॑ नः पर॒स्पास्त्वं वस्य॒ आ वृ॑षभ प्रणे॒ता अग्ने॑ तो॒कस्य॑ न॒स्तने॑ त॒नूना॒मप्र॑युच्छ॒न्दीद्य॑द्बोधि गो॒पाः
verses.transliteration: tváṃ dūtás tvám u naḥ paraspā́s  tváṃ vásya ā́ vr̥ṣabha praṇetā́  ágne tokásya nas táne tanū́nām  áprayuchan dī́dyad bodhi gopā́ḥ

translation.text: Envoy art thou, protector from the foeman, strong God, thou leadest us to higher blessings. Refulgent, be an ever-heedful keeper, Agni, for us and for our seed offspring.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वि॒धेम॑ ते पर॒मे जन्म॑न्नग्ने वि॒धेम॒ स्तोमै॒रव॑रे स॒धस्थे॑ यस्मा॒द्योने॑रु॒दारि॑था॒ यजे॒ तं प्र त्वे ह॒वींषि॑ जुहुरे॒ समि॑द्धे
verses.transliteration: vidhéma te paramé jánmann agne  vidhéma stómair ávare sadhásthe  yásmād yóner udā́rithā yáje tám  prá tvé havī́ṃṣi juhure sámiddhe

translation.text: May we adore thee in thy loftiest birthplace, and, with our praises, in thy lower station. The place whence thou issued forth I worship: to thee well kindled have they paid oblations.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अग्ने॒ यज॑स्व ह॒विषा॒ यजी॑याञ्छ्रु॒ष्टी दे॒ष्णम॒भि गृ॑णीहि॒ राधः॑ त्वं ह्यसि॑ रयि॒पती॑ रयी॒णां त्वं शु॒क्रस्य॒ वच॑सो म॒नोता॑
verses.transliteration: ágne yájasva havíṣā yájīyāñ  -śruṣṭī́ deṣṇám abhí gr̥ṇīhi rā́dhaḥ  tváṃ hy ási rayipátī rayīṇā́ṃ  tváṃ śukrásya vácaso manótā

translation.text: Agni, best Priest, pay worship with oblation; quickly commend the gift to be presented; For thou art Lord of gathered wealth and treasure. of the bright song of praise thou art inventor.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उ॒भयं॑ ते॒ न क्षी॑यते वस॒व्यं॑ दि॒वेदि॑वे॒ जाय॑मानस्य दस्म कृ॒धि क्षु॒मन्तं॑ जरि॒तार॑मग्ने कृ॒धि पतिं॑ स्वप॒त्यस्य॑ रा॒यः
verses.transliteration: ubháyaṃ te ná kṣīyate vasavyàṃ  divé-dive jā́yamānasya dasma  kr̥dhí kṣumántaṃ jaritā́ram agne  kr̥dhí pátiṃ svapatyásya rāyáḥ

translation.text: The twofold opulence, O Wonder-Worker, of thee new-born each day never decreases. Enrich with food the man who lauds thee, Agni: make him the lord of wealth with noble offspring.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सैनानी॑केन सुवि॒दत्रो॑ अ॒स्मे यष्टा॑ दे॒वाँ आय॑जिष्ठः स्व॒स्ति अद॑ब्धो गो॒पा उ॒त नः॑ पर॒स्पा अग्ने॑ द्यु॒मदु॒त रे॒वद्दि॑दीहि
verses.transliteration: saínā́nīkena suvidátro asmé  yáṣṭā devā́m̐ ā́yajiṣṭhaḥ svastí  ádabdho gopā́ utá naḥ paraspā́ḥ-  ágne dyumád utá revád didīhi

translation.text: May he, benevolent with this fair aspect, best sacrificer, bring the Gods to bless us. Sure guardian, our protector from the foemen, shine, Agni, with thine affluence and splendour.

verses.sanskrit_deva: जो॒हूत्रो॑ अ॒ग्निः प्र॑थ॒मः पि॒तेवे॒ळस्प॒दे मनु॑षा॒ यत्समि॑द्धः श्रियं॒ वसा॑नो अ॒मृतो॒ विचे॑ता मर्मृ॒जेन्यः॑ श्रव॒स्य१॒॑ः स वा॒जी
verses.transliteration: johū́tro agníḥ prathamáḥ pitéva-  -iḷás padé mánuṣā yát sámiddhaḥ  śríyaṃ vásāno amŕ̥to vícetāḥ-  marmr̥jényaḥ śravasyàḥ sá vājī́

translation.text: AGNI, first, loudly calling, like a Father, kindled by man upon the seat of worship. Clothed in his glory, deathless, keen of insight, must be adorned by all, the Strong, the Famous.

verses.sanskrit_deva: श्रू॒या अ॒ग्निश्चि॒त्रभा॑नु॒र्हवं॑ मे॒ विश्वा॑भिर्गी॒र्भिर॒मृतो॒ विचे॑ताः श्या॒वा रथं॑ वहतो॒ रोहि॑ता वो॒तारु॒षाह॑ चक्रे॒ विभृ॑त्रः
verses.transliteration: śrūyā́ agníś citrábhānur hávam me  víśvābhir gīrbhír amŕ̥to vícetāḥ  śyāvā́ ráthaṃ vahato róhitā vā-  -utā́ruṣā́ha cakre víbhr̥traḥ

translation.text: May Agni the resplendent hear my calling through all my songs, Immortal, keen of insight. Dark steeds or ruddy draw his car, or carried in sundry ways he makes them red of colour.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उ॒त्ता॒नाया॑मजनय॒न्त्सुषू॑तं॒ भुव॑द॒ग्निः पु॑रु॒पेशा॑सु॒ गर्भः॑ शिरि॑णायां चिद॒क्तुना॒ महो॑भि॒रप॑रीवृतो वसति॒ प्रचे॑ताः
verses.transliteration: uttānā́yām ajanayan súṣūtam  bhúvad agníḥ purupéśāsu gárbhaḥ  śíriṇāyāṃ cid aktúnā máhobhir  áparīvr̥to vasati prácetāḥ

translation.text: On wood supine they got the well-formed Infant: a germ in various-fashioned plants was Agni; And in the night, not compassed round by darkness, he dwells exceeding wise, with rays of splendour.

verses.sanskrit_deva: जिघ॑र्म्य॒ग्निं ह॒विषा॑ घृ॒तेन॑ प्रतिक्षि॒यन्तं॒ भुव॑नानि॒ विश्वा॑ पृ॒थुं ति॑र॒श्चा वय॑सा बृ॒हन्तं॒ व्यचि॑ष्ठ॒मन्नै॑ रभ॒सं दृशा॑नम्
verses.transliteration: jígharmy agníṃ havíṣā ghr̥téna  pratikṣiyántam bhúvanāni víśvā  pr̥thúṃ tiraścā́ váyasā br̥hántaṃ  vyáciṣṭham ánnai rabhasáṃ dŕ̥śānam

translation.text: With oil and sacred gifts I sprinkle Agni who makes his home in front of all things living, Broad, vast, through vital power o'er all expanded, conspicuous, strong with all the food that feeds him.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ वि॒श्वतः॑ प्र॒त्यञ्चं॑ जिघर्म्यर॒क्षसा॒ मन॑सा॒ तज्जु॑षेत मर्य॑श्रीः स्पृह॒यद्व॑र्णो अ॒ग्निर्नाभि॒मृशे॑ त॒न्वा॒३॒॑ जर्भु॑राणः
verses.transliteration: ā́ viśvátaḥ pratyáñcaṃ jigharmi-  arakṣásā mánasā táj juṣeta  máryaśrī spr̥hayádvarṇo agnír  nā́bhimŕ̥śe tanvā̀ járbhurāṇaḥ

translation.text: I pour to him who looks in all directions: may he accept it with a friendly spirit. Agni with bridegroom's grace and lovely colour may not be touched when all his form is fury.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ज्ञे॒या भा॒गं स॑हसा॒नो वरे॑ण॒ त्वादू॑तासो मनु॒वद्व॑देम अनू॑नम॒ग्निं जु॒ह्वा॑ वच॒स्या म॑धु॒पृचं॑ धन॒सा जो॑हवीमि
verses.transliteration: jñeyā́ bhāgáṃ sahasānó váreṇa  tvā́dūtāso manuvád vadema  ánūnam agníṃ juhvā̀ vacasyā́  madhupŕ̥caṃ dhanasā́ johavīmi

translation.text: By choice victorious, recognize thy portion: with thee for envoy may we speak like Manu. Obtaining wealth, I call on perfect Agni who with an eloquent tongue dispenses sweetness.

verses.sanskrit_deva: श्रु॒धी हव॑मिन्द्र॒ मा रि॑षण्यः॒ स्याम॑ ते दा॒वने॒ वसू॑नाम् इ॒मा हि त्वामूर्जो॑ व॒र्धय॑न्ति वसू॒यवः॒ सिन्ध॑वो॒ न क्षर॑न्तः
verses.transliteration: śrudhī́ hávam indra mā́ riṣaṇyaḥ  syā́ma te dāváne vásūnām  imā́ hí tvā́m ū́rjo vardháyanti  vasūyávaḥ síndhavo ná kṣárantaḥ

translation.text: HEAR thou my call, O Indra; be not heedless: thine may we be for thee to give us treasures; For these presented viands, seeking riches, increase thy strength like streams of water flowing.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सृ॒जो म॒हीरि॑न्द्र॒ या अपि॑न्वः॒ परि॑ष्ठिता॒ अहि॑ना शूर पू॒र्वीः अम॑र्त्यं चिद्दा॒सं मन्य॑मान॒मवा॑भिनदु॒क्थैर्वा॑वृधा॒नः
verses.transliteration: sr̥jó mahī́r indra yā́ ápinvaḥ  páriṣṭhitā áhinā śūra pūrvī́ḥ  ámartyaṃ cid dāsám mányamānam  ávābhinad ukthaír vāvr̥dhānáḥ

translation.text: Floods great and many, compassed by the Dragon, thou badest swell and settest free, O Hero. Strengthened by songs of praise thou rentest piecemeal the Dâsa, him who deemed himself immortal.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उ॒क्थेष्विन्नु शू॑र॒ येषु॑ चा॒कन्त्स्तोमे॑ष्विन्द्र रु॒द्रिये॑षु च तुभ्येदे॒ता यासु॑ मन्दसा॒नः प्र वा॒यवे॑ सिस्रते॒ न शु॒भ्राः
verses.transliteration: ukthéṣv ín nú śūra yéṣu cākán  stómeṣv indra rudríyeṣu ca  túbhyéd etā́ yā́su mandasānáḥ  prá vāyáve sisrate ná śubhrā́ḥ

translation.text: For, Hero, in the lauds wherein thou joyedst, in hymns of praise, O Indra, songs of Rudras, These streams in which is thy delight approach thee, even as the brilliant ones draw near to Vâyu.

verses.sanskrit_deva: शु॒भ्रं नु ते॒ शुष्मं॑ व॒र्धय॑न्तः शु॒भ्रं वज्रं॑ बा॒ह्वोर्दधा॑नाः शु॒भ्रस्त्वमि॑न्द्र वावृधा॒नो अ॒स्मे दासी॒र्विशः॒ सूर्ये॑ण सह्याः
verses.transliteration: śubhráṃ nú te śúṣmaṃ vardháyantaḥ  śubhráṃ vájram bāhvór dádhānāḥ  śubhrás tvám indra vāvr̥dhānó asmé  dā́sīr víśaḥ sū́ryeṇa sahyāḥ

translation.text: We who add strength to thine own splendid vigour, laying within thine arms the splendid thunder- With us mayst thou, O Indra, waxen splendid, with Sûrya overcome the Dâsa races.

verses.sanskrit_deva: गुहा॑ हि॒तं गुह्यं॑ गू॒ळ्हम॒प्स्वपी॑वृतं मा॒यिनं॑ क्षि॒यन्त॑म् उ॒तो अ॒पो द्यां त॑स्त॒भ्वांस॒मह॒न्नहिं॑ शूर वी॒र्ये॑ण
verses.transliteration: gúhā hitáṃ gúhyaṃ gūḷhám apsú-  ápīvr̥tam māyínaṃ kṣiyántam  utó apó dyā́ṃ tastabhvā́ṃsam  áhann áhiṃ śūra vīryèṇa

translation.text: Hero, thou slewest in thy valour Ahi concealed in depths, mysterious, great enchanter, Dwelling enveloped deep within the waters, him who checked heaven and stayed the floods from flowing.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स्तवा॒ नु त॑ इन्द्र पू॒र्व्या म॒हान्यु॒त स्त॑वाम॒ नूत॑ना कृ॒तानि॑ स्तवा॒ वज्रं॑ बा॒ह्वोरु॒शन्तं॒ स्तवा॒ हरी॒ सूर्य॑स्य के॒तू
verses.transliteration: stávā nú ta indra pūrvyā́ mahā́ni-  utá stavāma nū́tanā kr̥tā́ni  stávā vájram bāhvór uśántaṃ  stávā hárī sū́ryasya ketū́

translation.text: Indra, we laud thy great deeds wrought aforetime, we laud thine exploits later of achievement; We laud the bolt that in thine arms lies eager; we laud thy two Bay Steeds, heralds of Sûrya.

verses.sanskrit_deva: हरी॒ नु त॑ इन्द्र वा॒जय॑न्ता घृत॒श्चुतं॑ स्वा॒रम॑स्वार्ष्टाम् वि स॑म॒ना भूमि॑रप्रथि॒ष्टारं॑स्त॒ पर्व॑तश्चित्सरि॒ष्यन्
verses.transliteration: hárī nú ta indra vājáyantā  ghr̥taścútaṃ svārám asvārṣṭām  ví samanā́ bhū́mir aprathiṣṭa-  -áraṃsta párvataś cit sariṣyán

translation.text: Indra, thy Bay Steeds showing forth their vigour have sent a loud cry out that droppeth fatness. The earth hath spread herself in all her fulness: the cloud that was about to move hath rested.

verses.sanskrit_deva: नि पर्व॑तः सा॒द्यप्र॑युच्छ॒न्त्सं मा॒तृभि॑र्वावशा॒नो अ॑क्रान् दू॒रे पा॒रे वाणीं॑ व॒र्धय॑न्त॒ इन्द्रे॑षितां ध॒मनिं॑ पप्रथ॒न्नि
verses.transliteration: ní párvataḥ sādy áprayuchan  sám mātŕ̥bhir vāvaśānó akrān  dūré pāré vā́ṇīṃ vardháyantaḥ-  índreṣitāṃ dhamánim paprathan ní

translation.text: Down, never ceasing, hath the rain-cloud settled: bellowing, it hath wandered with the Mothers. Swelling the roar in the far distant limits, they have spread wide the blast sent forth by Indra.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इन्द्रो॑ म॒हां सिन्धु॑मा॒शया॑नं माया॒विनं॑ वृ॒त्रम॑स्फुर॒न्निः अरे॑जेतां॒ रोद॑सी भिया॒ने कनि॑क्रदतो॒ वृष्णो॑ अस्य॒ वज्रा॑त्
verses.transliteration: índro mahā́ṃ síndhum āśáyānam  māyāvínaṃ vr̥trám asphuran níḥ  árejetāṃ ródasī bhiyāné  kánikradato vŕ̥ṣṇo asya vájrāt

translation.text: Indra hath hurled down the magician Vr̥itra who lay beleaguering the mighty river. Then both the heaven and earth trembled in terror at the strong Hero's thunder when he bellowed.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अरो॑रवी॒द्वृष्णो॑ अस्य॒ वज्रोऽमा॑नुषं॒ यन्मानु॑षो नि॒जूर्वा॑त् नि मा॒यिनो॑ दान॒वस्य॑ मा॒या अपा॑दयत्पपि॒वान्त्सु॒तस्य॑
verses.transliteration: ároravīd vŕ̥ṣṇo asya vájraḥ-  -ámānuṣaṃ yán mā́nuṣo nijū́rvāt  ní māyíno dānavásya māyā́ḥ-  ápādayat papivā́n sutásya

translation.text: Loud roared the mighty Hero's bolt of thunder, when he, the Friend of man, burnt up the monster, And, having drunk his fill of flowing Soma, baffled the guileful Dânava's devices.

verses.sanskrit_deva: पिबा॑पि॒बेदि॑न्द्र शूर॒ सोमं॒ मन्द॑न्तु त्वा म॒न्दिनः॑ सु॒तासः॑ पृ॒णन्त॑स्ते कु॒क्षी व॑र्धयन्त्वि॒त्था सु॒तः पौ॒र इन्द्र॑माव
verses.transliteration: píbā-pibéd indra śūra sómam  mándantu tvā mandínaḥ sutā́saḥ  pr̥ṇántas te kukṣī́ vardhayantu-  itthā́ sutáḥ paurá índram āva

translation.text: Drink thou, O Hero Indra, drink the Soma; let the joy-giving juices make thee joyful. They, filling both thy flanks, shall swell thy vigour. The juice that satisfies hath helped Indra.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वे इ॒न्द्राप्य॑भूम॒ विप्रा॒ धियं॑ वनेम ऋत॒या सप॑न्तः अ॒व॒स्यवो॑ धीमहि॒ प्रश॑स्तिं स॒द्यस्ते॑ रा॒यो दा॒वने॑ स्याम
verses.transliteration: tvé indrā́py abhūma víprāḥ-  dhíyaṃ vanema r̥tayā́ sápantaḥ  avasyávo dhīmahi práśastiṃ  sadyás te rāyó dāváne syāma

translation.text: Singers have we become with thee, O Indra: may we serve duly and prepare devotion. Seeking thy help we meditate thy praises: may we at once enjoy thy gift of riches.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स्याम॒ ते त॑ इन्द्र॒ ये त॑ ऊ॒ती अ॑व॒स्यव॒ ऊर्जं॑ व॒र्धय॑न्तः शु॒ष्मिन्त॑मं॒ यं चा॒कना॑म देवा॒स्मे र॒यिं रा॑सि वी॒रव॑न्तम्
verses.transliteration: syā́ma té ta indra yé ta ūtī́  avasyáva ū́rjaṃ vardháyantaḥ  śuṣmíntamaṃ yáṃ cākánāma deva-  -asmé rayíṃ rāsi vīrávantam

translation.text: May we be thine, such by thy help, O Indra, as swell thy vigour while they seek thy favour. Give us, thou God, the riches that we long for, most powerful, with stare of noble children.

verses.sanskrit_deva: रासि॒ क्षयं॒ रासि॑ मि॒त्रम॒स्मे रासि॒ शर्ध॑ इन्द्र॒ मारु॑तं नः स॒जोष॑सो॒ ये च॑ मन्दसा॒नाः प्र वा॒यवः॑ पा॒न्त्यग्र॑णीतिम्
verses.transliteration: rā́si kṣáyaṃ rā́si mitrám asmé  rā́si śárdha indra mā́rutaṃ naḥ  sajóṣaso yé ca mandasānā́ḥ  prá vāyávaḥ pānty ágraṇītim

translation.text: Give us a friend, give us an habitation; Indra, give us the company of Maruts, And those whose minds accord with theirs, the Vâyus, who drink the first libation of the Soma.

verses.sanskrit_deva: व्यन्त्विन्नु येषु॑ मन्दसा॒नस्तृ॒पत्सोमं॑ पाहि द्र॒ह्यदि॑न्द्र अ॒स्मान्त्सु पृ॒त्स्वा त॑रु॒त्राव॑र्धयो॒ द्यां बृ॒हद्भि॑र॒र्कैः
verses.transliteration: vyántv ín nú yéṣu mandasānás  tr̥pát sómam pāhi drahyád indra  asmā́n sú pr̥tsv ā́ tarutra-  -ávardhayo dyā́m br̥hádbhir arkaíḥ

translation.text: Let those enjoy in whom thou art delighted. Indra, drink Soma for thy strength and gladness. Thou hast exalted us to heaven, Preserver, in battles, through the lofty hymns that praise thee.

verses.sanskrit_deva: बृ॒हन्त॒ इन्नु ये ते॑ तरुत्रो॒क्थेभि॑र्वा सु॒म्नमा॒विवा॑सान् स्तृ॒णा॒नासो॑ ब॒र्हिः प॒स्त्या॑व॒त्त्वोता॒ इदि॑न्द्र॒ वाज॑मग्मन्
verses.transliteration: br̥hánta ín nú yé te tarutra-  -ukthébhir vā sumnám āvívāsān  str̥ṇānā́so barhíḥ pastyā̀vat  tvótā íd indra vā́jam agman

translation.text: Great, verily, are they, O thou Protector, who by their songs of praise have won the blessing. They who strew sacred grass to be thy dwelling, helped by thee have got them strength, O Indra.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उ॒ग्रेष्विन्नु शू॑र मन्दसा॒नस्त्रिक॑द्रुकेषु पाहि॒ सोम॑मिन्द्र प्र॒दोधु॑व॒च्छ्मश्रु॑षु प्रीणा॒नो या॒हि हरि॑भ्यां सु॒तस्य॑ पी॒तिम्
verses.transliteration: ugréṣv ín nú śūra mandasānás  tríkadrukeṣu pāhi sómam indra  pradódhuvac chmáśruṣu prīṇānó  yāhí háribhyāṃ sutásya pītím

translation.text: Upon the great Trikadruka days, Hero, rejoicing thee, O Indra, drink the Soma. Come with Bay Steeds to drink of libation, shaking the drops from out thy beard, contented.

verses.sanskrit_deva: धि॒ष्वा शवः॑ शूर॒ येन॑ वृ॒त्रम॒वाभि॑न॒द्दानु॑मौर्णवा॒भम् अपा॑वृणो॒र्ज्योति॒रार्या॑य॒ नि स॑व्य॒तः सा॑दि॒ दस्यु॑रिन्द्र
verses.transliteration: dhiṣvā́ śávaḥ śūra yéna vr̥trám  avā́bhinad dā́num aurṇavābhám  ápāvr̥ṇor jyótir ā́ryāya  ní savyatáḥ sādi dásyur indra

translation.text: Hero, assume the might wherewith thou clavest Vr̥itra piecemeal, the Dânava Aurṇavâbha. Thou hast disclosed the light to light the Arya: on thy left hand, O Indra, sank the Dasyu.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सने॑म॒ ये त॑ ऊ॒तिभि॒स्तर॑न्तो॒ विश्वाः॒ स्पृध॒ आर्ये॑ण॒ दस्यू॑न् अ॒स्मभ्यं॒ तत्त्वा॒ष्ट्रं वि॒श्वरू॑प॒मर॑न्धयः सा॒ख्यस्य॑ त्रि॒ताय॑
verses.transliteration: sánema yé ta ūtíbhis táranto  víśvā spŕ̥dha ā́ryeṇa dásyūn  asmábhyaṃ tát tvāṣṭráṃ viśvárūpam  árandhayaḥ sākhyásya tritā́ya

translation.text: May we gain wealth, subduing with thy succour and with the Ârya, all our foes, the Dasyus. Our gain was that to Trita of our party thou gavest up Tvashṭar's son Viṣvarûpâ.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒स्य सु॑वा॒नस्य॑ म॒न्दिन॑स्त्रि॒तस्य॒ न्यर्बु॑दं वावृधा॒नो अ॑स्तः अव॑र्तय॒त्सूर्यो॒ न च॒क्रं भि॒नद्व॒लमिन्द्रो॒ अङ्गि॑रस्वान्
verses.transliteration: asyá suvānásya mandínas tritásya  ny árbudaṃ vāvr̥dhānó astaḥ  ávartayat sū́ryo ná cakrám  bhinád valám índro áṅgirasvān

translation.text: He cast down Arbuda what time his vigour was strengthened by libations poured by Trita. Indra sent forth his whirling wheel like Sûrya, and aided by the Angirases rent Vala.

verses.sanskrit_deva: नू॒नं सा ते॒ प्रति॒ वरं॑ जरि॒त्रे दु॑ही॒यदि॑न्द्र॒ दक्षि॑णा म॒घोनी॑ शिक्षा॑ स्तो॒तृभ्यो॒ माति॑ ध॒ग्भगो॑ नो बृ॒हद्व॑देम वि॒दथे॑ सु॒वीराः॑
verses.transliteration: nūnáṃ sā́ te práti váraṃ jaritré  duhīyád indra dákṣiṇā maghónī  śíkṣā stotŕ̥bhyo mā́ti dhag bhágo no  br̥hád vadema vidáthe suvī́rāḥ

translation.text: Now let that wealthy Cow of thine, O Indra, yield in return a boon to him who lauds thee. Give to thy praisers: let not fortune fail us. Loud may we speak, with brave men, in the assembly.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यो जा॒त ए॒व प्र॑थ॒मो मन॑स्वान्दे॒वो दे॒वान्क्रतु॑ना प॒र्यभू॑षत् यस्य॒ शुष्मा॒द्रोद॑सी॒ अभ्य॑सेतां नृ॒म्णस्य॑ म॒ह्ना स ज॑नास॒ इन्द्रः॑
verses.transliteration: yó jātá evá prathamó mánasvān  devó devā́n krátunā paryábhūṣat  yásya śúṣmād ródasī ábhyasetāṃ  nr̥mṇásya mahnā́ sá janāsa índraḥ

translation.text: HE who, just born, chief God of lofty spirit by power and might became the Gods' protector, Before whose breath through greatness of his valour the two worlds trembled, He, O men, is Indra.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यः पृ॑थि॒वीं व्यथ॑माना॒मदृं॑ह॒द्यः पर्व॑ता॒न्प्रकु॑पिताँ॒ अर॑म्णात् यो अ॒न्तरि॑क्षं विम॒मे वरी॑यो॒ यो द्यामस्त॑भ्ना॒त्स ज॑नास॒ इन्द्रः॑
verses.transliteration: yáḥ pr̥thivī́ṃ vyáthamānām ádr̥ṃhad  yáḥ párvatān prákupitām̐ áramṇāt  yó antárikṣaṃ vimamé várīyo  yó dyā́m ástabhnāt sá janāsa índraḥ

translation.text: He who fixed fast and firm the earth that staggered, and set at rest the agitated mountains, Who measured out the air's wide middle region and gave the heaven support, He, men, is Indra.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यो ह॒त्वाहि॒मरि॑णात्स॒प्त सिन्धू॒न्यो गा उ॒दाज॑दप॒धा व॒लस्य॑ यो अश्म॑नोर॒न्तर॒ग्निं ज॒जान॑ सं॒वृक्स॒मत्सु॒ स ज॑नास॒ इन्द्रः॑
verses.transliteration: yó hatvā́him áriṇāt saptá síndhūn  yó gā́ udā́jad apadhā́ valásya  yó áśmanor antár agníṃ jajā́na  saṃvŕ̥k samátsu sá janāsa índraḥ

translation.text: Who slew the Dragon, freed the Seven Rivers, and drove the kine forth from the cave of Vala, Begat the fire between two stones, the spoiler in warriors' battle, He, O men, is Indra.

verses.sanskrit_deva: येने॒मा विश्वा॒ च्यव॑ना कृ॒तानि॒ यो दासं॒ वर्ण॒मध॑रं॒ गुहाकः॑ श्व॒घ्नीव॒ यो जि॑गी॒वाँल्ल॒क्षमाद॑द॒र्यः पु॒ष्टानि॒ स ज॑नास॒ इन्द्रः॑
verses.transliteration: yénemā́ víśvā cyávanā kr̥tā́ni  yó dā́saṃ várṇam ádharaṃ gúhā́kaḥ  śvaghnī́va yó jigīvā́m̐ lakṣám ā́dad  aryáḥ puṣṭā́ni sá janāsa índraḥ

translation.text: By whom this universe was made to tremble, who chased away the humbled brood of demons, Who, like a gambler gathering his winnings seized the foe's riches, He, O men, is Indra.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यं स्मा॑ पृ॒च्छन्ति॒ कुह॒ सेति॑ घो॒रमु॒तेमा॑हु॒र्नैषो अ॒स्तीत्ये॑नम् सो अ॒र्यः पु॒ष्टीर्विज॑ इ॒वा मि॑नाति॒ श्रद॑स्मै धत्त॒ स ज॑नास॒ इन्द्रः॑
verses.transliteration: yáṃ smā pr̥chánti kúha séti ghorám  utém āhur naíṣó astī́ty enam  só aryáḥ puṣṭī́r víja ivā́ mināti  śrád asmai dhatta sá janāsa índraḥ

translation.text: Of whom, the Terrible, they ask, Where is He? or verily they say of him, He is not. He sweeps away, like birds, the foe's possessions. Have faith in him, for He, O men, is Indra.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यो र॒ध्रस्य॑ चोदि॒ता यः कृ॒शस्य॒ यो ब्र॒ह्मणो॒ नाध॑मानस्य की॒रेः यु॒क्तग्रा॑व्णो॒ यो॑ऽवि॒ता सु॑शि॒प्रः सु॒तसो॑मस्य॒ स ज॑नास॒ इन्द्रः॑
verses.transliteration: yó radhrásya coditā́ yáḥ kr̥śásya  yó brahmáṇo nā́dhamānasya kīréḥ  yuktágrāvṇo yó 'vitā́ suśipráḥ  sutásomasya sá janāsa índraḥ

translation.text: Stirrer to action of the poor and lowly, of priest, of suppliant who sings his praises; Who, fair-faced, favours him who presses Soma with stones made ready, He, O men, is Indra.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यस्याश्वा॑सः प्र॒दिशि॒ यस्य॒ गावो॒ यस्य॒ ग्रामा॒ यस्य॒ विश्वे॒ रथा॑सः यः सूर्यं॒ य उ॒षसं॑ ज॒जान॒ यो अ॒पां ने॒ता स ज॑नास॒ इन्द्रः॑
verses.transliteration: yásyā́śvāsaḥ pradíśi yásya gā́vo  yásya grā́mā yásya víśve ráthāsaḥ  yáḥ sū́ryaṃ yá uṣásaṃ jajā́na  yó apā́ṃ netā́ sá janāsa índraḥ

translation.text: He under whose supreme control are horses, all chariots, and the villages, and cattle; He who gave being to the Sun and Morning, who leads the waters, He, O men, is Indra.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यं क्रन्द॑सी संय॒ती वि॒ह्वये॑ते॒ परेऽव॑र उ॒भया॑ अ॒मित्राः॑ स॒मा॒नं चि॒द्रथ॑मातस्थि॒वांसा॒ नाना॑ हवेते॒ स ज॑नास॒ इन्द्रः॑
verses.transliteration: yáṃ krándasī saṃyatī́ vihváyete  páré 'vara ubháyā amítrāḥ  samānáṃ cid rátham ātasthivā́ṃsā  nā́nā havete sá janāsa índraḥ

translation.text: To whom two armies cry in close encounter, both enemies, the stronger and the weaker; Whom two invoke upon one chariot mounted, each for himself, He, O ye men, is Indra.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यस्मा॒न्न ऋ॒ते वि॒जय॑न्ते॒ जना॑सो॒ यं युध्य॑माना॒ अव॑से॒ हव॑न्ते यो विश्व॑स्य प्रति॒मानं॑ ब॒भूव॒ यो अ॑च्युत॒च्युत्स ज॑नास॒ इन्द्रः॑
verses.transliteration: yásmān ná r̥té vijáyante jánāso  yáṃ yúdhyamānā ávase hávante  yó víśvasya pratimā́nam babhū́va  yó acyutacyút sá janāsa índraḥ

translation.text: Without whose help our people never conquer; whom, battling, they invoke to give them succour; He of whom all this world is but the copy, who shakes things moveless, He, O men, is Indra.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यः शश्व॑तो॒ मह्येनो॒ दधा॑ना॒नम॑न्यमाना॒ञ्छर्वा॑ ज॒घान॑ यः शर्ध॑ते॒ नानु॒ददा॑ति शृ॒ध्यां यो दस्यो॑र्ह॒न्ता स ज॑नास॒ इन्द्रः॑
verses.transliteration: yáḥ śáśvato máhy éno dádhānān  ámanyamānāñ chárvā jaghā́na  yáḥ śárdhate nā́nudádāti śr̥dhyā́ṃ  yó dásyor hantā́ sá janāsa índraḥ

translation.text: He who hath smitten, ere they knew their danger, with his hurled weapon many grievous sinners; Who pardons not his boldness who provokes him, who slays the Dasyti, He, O men, is Indra.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यः शम्ब॑रं॒ पर्व॑तेषु क्षि॒यन्तं॑ चत्वारिं॒श्यां श॒रद्य॒न्ववि॑न्दत् ओ॒जा॒यमा॑नं॒ यो अहिं॑ ज॒घान॒ दानुं॒ शया॑नं॒ स ज॑नास॒ इन्द्रः॑
verses.transliteration: yáḥ śámbaram párvateṣu kṣiyántaṃ  catvāriṃśyā́ṃ śarády anvávindat  ojāyámānaṃ yó áhiṃ jaghā́na  dā́nuṃ śáyānaṃ sá janāsa índraḥ

translation.text: He who discovered in the fortieth autumn Ṣambara as he dwelt among the mountains; Who slew the Dragon putting forth his vigour, the demon lying there, He, men, is Indra.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यः स॒प्तर॑श्मिर्वृष॒भस्तुवि॑ष्मान॒वासृ॑ज॒त्सर्त॑वे स॒प्त सिन्धू॑न् यो रौ॑हि॒णमस्फु॑र॒द्वज्र॑बाहु॒र्द्यामा॒रोह॑न्तं॒ स ज॑नास॒ इन्द्रः॑
verses.transliteration: yáḥ saptáraśmir vr̥ṣabhás túviṣmān  avā́sr̥jat sártave saptá síndhūn  yó rauhiṇám ásphurad vájrabāhur  dyā́m āróhantaṃ sá janāsa índraḥ

translation.text: Who with seven guiding reins, the Bull, the Mighty, set free the Seven great Floods to flow at pleasure; Who, thunder-armed, rent Rauhiṇa in pieces when scaling heaven, He, O ye men, is Indra.

verses.sanskrit_deva: द्यावा॑ चिदस्मै पृथि॒वी न॑मेते॒ शुष्मा॑च्चिदस्य॒ पर्व॑ता भयन्ते यः सो॑म॒पा नि॑चि॒तो वज्र॑बाहु॒र्यो वज्र॑हस्तः॒ स ज॑नास॒ इन्द्रः॑
verses.transliteration: dyā́vā cid asmai pr̥thivī́ namete  śúṣmāc cid asya párvatā bhayante  yáḥ somapā́ nicitó vájrabāhur  yó vájrahastaḥ sá janāsa índraḥ

translation.text: Even the Heaven and Earth bow down before him, before his very breath the mountains tremble. Known as the Soma-drinker, armed with thunder, who wields the bolt, He, O ye men, is Indra.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यः सु॒न्वन्त॒मव॑ति॒ यः पच॑न्तं॒ यः शंस॑न्तं॒ यः श॑शमा॒नमू॒ती यस्य॒ ब्रह्म॒ वर्ध॑नं॒ यस्य॒ सोमो॒ यस्ये॒दं राधः॒ स ज॑नास॒ इन्द्रः॑
verses.transliteration: yáḥ sunvántam ávati yáḥ pácantaṃ  yáḥ śáṃsantaṃ yáḥ śaśamānám ūtī́  yásya bráhma várdhanaṃ yásya sómo  yásyedáṃ rā́dhaḥ sá janāsa índraḥ

translation.text: Who aids with favour him who pours the Soma and him who brews it, sacrificer, singer. Whom prayer exalts, and pouring forth of Soma, and this our gift, He, O ye men, Is Indra.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यः सु॑न्व॒ते पच॑ते दु॒ध्र आ चि॒द्वाजं॒ दर्द॑र्षि॒ स किला॑सि स॒त्यः व॒यं त॑ इन्द्र वि॒श्वह॑ प्रि॒यासः॑ सु॒वीरा॑सो वि॒दथ॒मा व॑देम
verses.transliteration: yáḥ sunvaté pácate dudhrá ā́ cid  vā́jaṃ dárdarṣi sá kílāsi satyáḥ  vayáṃ ta indra viśváha priyā́saḥ  suvī́rāso vidátham ā́ vadema

translation.text: Thou verily art fierce and true who sendest strength to the man who brews and pours libation. So may we evermore, thy friends, O Indra, speak loudly to the synod with our heroes.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ऋ॒तुर्जनि॑त्री॒ तस्या॑ अ॒पस्परि॑ म॒क्षू जा॒त आवि॑श॒द्यासु॒ वर्ध॑ते तदा॑ह॒ना अ॑भवत्पि॒प्युषी॒ पयों॒ऽशोः पी॒यूषं॑ प्रथ॒मं तदु॒क्थ्य॑म्
verses.transliteration: r̥túr jánitrī tásyā apás pári  makṣū́ jātá ā́viśad yā́su várdhate  tád āhanā́ abhavat pipyúṣī páyo  -aṃśóḥ pīyū́ṣam prathamáṃ tád ukthyàm

translation.text: THE Season was the parent, and when born therefrom it entered rapidly the floods wherein it grows. Thence was it full of sap, streaming with milky juice: the milk of the plant's stalk is chief and meet for lauds.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स॒ध्रीमा य॑न्ति॒ परि॒ बिभ्र॑तीः॒ पयो॑ वि॒श्वप्स्न्या॑य॒ प्र भ॑रन्त॒ भोज॑नम् स॒मा॒नो अध्वा॑ प्र॒वता॑मनु॒ष्यदे॒ यस्ताकृ॑णोः प्रथ॒मं सास्यु॒क्थ्यः॑
verses.transliteration: sadhrī́m ā́ yanti pári bíbhratīḥ páyo  viśvápsnyāya prá bharanta bhójanam  samānó ádhvā pravátām anuṣyáde  yás tā́kr̥ṇoḥ prathamáṃ sā́sy ukthyàḥ

translation.text: They come trooping together bearing milk to him, and bring him sustenance who gives support to all. The way is common for the downward streams to flow. Thou who didst these things first art worthy of our lauds.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अन्वेको॑ वदति॒ यद्ददा॑ति॒ तद्रू॒पा मि॒नन्तद॑पा॒ एक॑ ईयते विश्वा॒ एक॑स्य वि॒नुद॑स्तितिक्षते॒ यस्ताकृ॑णोः प्रथ॒मं सास्यु॒क्थ्यः॑
verses.transliteration: ánv éko vadati yád dádāti tád  rūpā́ minán tádapā éka īyate  víśvā ékasya vinúdas titikṣate  yás tā́kr̥ṇoḥ prathamáṃ sā́sy ukthyàḥ

translation.text: One priest announces what the institutor gives: one, altering the forms, zealously plies his task, The third corrects the imperfections left by each. Thou who didst these things first art worthy of our lauds.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र॒जाभ्यः॑ पु॒ष्टिं वि॒भज॑न्त आसते र॒यिमि॑व पृ॒ष्ठं प्र॒भव॑न्तमाय॒ते असि॑न्व॒न्दंष्ट्रैः॑ पि॒तुर॑त्ति॒ भोज॑नं॒ यस्ताकृ॑णोः प्रथ॒मं सास्यु॒क्थ्यः॑
verses.transliteration: prajā́bhyaḥ puṣṭíṃ vibhájanta āsate  rayím iva pr̥ṣṭhám prabhávantam āyaté  ásinvan dáṃṣṭraiḥ pitúr atti bhójanaṃ  yás tā́kr̥ṇoḥ prathamáṃ sā́sy ukthyàḥ

translation.text: Dealing out food unto their people there they sit, like wealth to him who comes, more than the back can bear. Greedily with his teeth he eats the master's food. Thou who didst these things first art worthy of our lauds.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अधा॑कृणोः पृथि॒वीं सं॒दृशे॑ दि॒वे यो धौ॑ती॒नाम॑हिह॒न्नारि॑णक्प॒थः तं त्वा॒ स्तोमे॑भिरु॒दभि॒र्न वा॒जिनं॑ दे॒वं दे॒वा अ॑जन॒न्त्सास्यु॒क्थ्यः॑
verses.transliteration: ádhākr̥ṇoḥ pr̥thivī́ṃ saṃdŕ̥śe divé  yó dhautīnā́m ahihann ā́riṇak patháḥ  táṃ tvā stómebhir udábhir ná vājínaṃ  deváṃ devā́ ajanan sā́sy ukthyàḥ

translation.text: Thou hast created earth to look upon the sky: thou, slaying Ahi, settest free the river's paths. Thee, such, a God, the Gods have quickened with their lauds, even as a steed with waters: meet for praise art thou.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यो भोज॑नं च॒ दय॑से च॒ वर्ध॑नमा॒र्द्रादा शुष्कं॒ मधु॑मद्दु॒दोहि॑थ स शे॑व॒धिं नि द॑धिषे वि॒वस्व॑ति॒ विश्व॒स्यैक॑ ईशिषे॒ सास्यु॒क्थ्यः॑
verses.transliteration: yó bhójanaṃ ca dáyase ca várdhanam  ārdrā́d ā́ śúṣkam mádhumad dudóhitha  sá śevadhíṃ ní dadhiṣe vivásvati  víśvasyaíka īśiṣe sā́sy ukthyàḥ

translation.text: Thou givest increase, thou dealest to us our food: thou milkest from the moist the dry, the rich in sweets. Thou by the worshipper layest thy precious store: thou art sole Lord of all. Meet for our praise art thou.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यः पु॒ष्पिणी॑श्च प्र॒स्व॑श्च॒ धर्म॒णाधि॒ दाने॒ व्य१॒॑वनी॒रधा॑रयः यश्चास॑मा॒ अज॑नो दि॒द्युतो॑ दि॒व उ॒रुरू॒र्वाँ अ॒भितः॒ सास्यु॒क्थ्यः॑
verses.transliteration: yáḥ puṣpíṇīś ca prasvàś ca dhármaṇā-  -ádhi dā́ne vy àvánīr ádhārayaḥ  yáś cā́samā ájano didyúto divé-  urúr ūrvā́m̐ abhítaḥ sā́sy ukthyàḥ

translation.text: Thou who hast spread abroad the streams by stablished law, and in the field the plants that blossom and bear seed; Thou who hast made the matchless lightnings of the sky,– vast, compassing vast realms, meet for our praise art thou.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यो ना॑र्म॒रं स॒हव॑सुं॒ निह॑न्तवे पृ॒क्षाय॑ च दा॒सवे॑शाय॒ चाव॑हः ऊ॒र्जय॑न्त्या॒ अप॑रिविष्टमा॒स्य॑मु॒तैवाद्य पु॑रुकृ॒त्सास्यु॒क्थ्यः॑
verses.transliteration: yó nārmaráṃ sahávasuṃ níhantave  pr̥kṣā́ya ca dāsáveśāya cā́vahaḥ  ūrjáyantyā ápariviṣṭam āsyàm  utaívā́dyá purukr̥t sā́sy ukthyàḥ

translation.text: Who broughtest Nârmara with all his wealth, for sake of food, to slay him that the fiends might be destroyed, Broughtest the face unclouded of the strengthening one, performing much even now, worthy art thou of praise.

verses.sanskrit_deva: श॒तं वा॒ यस्य॒ दश॑ सा॒कमाद्य॒ एक॑स्य श्रु॒ष्टौ यद्ध॑ चो॒दमावि॑थ अ॒र॒ज्जौ दस्यू॒न्त्समु॑नब्द॒भीत॑ये सुप्रा॒व्यो॑ अभवः॒ सास्यु॒क्थ्यः॑
verses.transliteration: śatáṃ vā yásya dáśa sākám ā́dyaḥ-  ékasya śruṣṭaú yád dha codám ā́vitha  arajjaú dásyūn sám unab dabhī́taye  suprāvyò abhavaḥ sā́sy ukthyàḥ

translation.text: Thou boundest up the Dâsa's hundred friends and ten, when, at one's hearing, thou belpest thy worshipper. Thou for Dabhîti boundest Dasyus not with cords; Thou wast a mighty help. Worthy of lauds art thou.

verses.sanskrit_deva: विश्वेदनु॑ रोध॒ना अ॑स्य॒ पौंस्यं॑ द॒दुर॑स्मै दधि॒रे कृ॒त्नवे॒ धन॑म् षळ॑स्तभ्ना वि॒ष्टिरः॒ पञ्च॑ सं॒दृशः॒ परि॑ प॒रो अ॑भवः॒ सास्यु॒क्थ्यः॑
verses.transliteration: víśvéd ánu rodhanā́ asya paúṃsyaṃ  dadúr asmai dadhiré kr̥tnáve dhánam  ṣáḷ astabhnā viṣṭíraḥ páñca saṃdŕ̥śaḥ  pári paró abhavaḥ sā́sy ukthyàḥ

translation.text: All banks of rivers yielded to his manly might; to him they gave, to him, the Strong, gave up their wealth. The six directions hast thou fixed, a five-fold view: thy victories reached afar. Worthy of lauds art thou.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सु॒प्र॒वा॒च॒नं तव॑ वीर वी॒र्यं१॒॑ यदेके॑न॒ क्रतु॑ना वि॒न्दसे॒ वसु॑ जा॒तूष्ठि॑रस्य॒ प्र वयः॒ सह॑स्वतो॒ या च॒कर्थ॒ सेन्द्र॒ विश्वा॑स्यु॒क्थ्यः॑
verses.transliteration: supravācanáṃ táva vīra vīryàṃ  yád ékena krátunā vindáse vásu  jātū́ṣṭhirasya prá váyaḥ sáhasvato  yā́ cakártha séndra víśvāsy ukthyàḥ

translation.text: Meet for high praise, O Hero, is thy power, that with thy single wisdom thou obtainest wealth, The life-support of conquering Jatusthira. Indra, for all thy deeds, worthy of lauds art thou.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अर॑मयः॒ सर॑पस॒स्तरा॑य॒ कं तु॒र्वीत॑ये च व॒य्या॑य च स्रु॒तिम् नी॒चा सन्त॒मुद॑नयः परा॒वृजं॒ प्रान्धं श्रो॒णं श्र॒वय॒न्त्सास्यु॒क्थ्यः॑
verses.transliteration: áramayaḥ sárapasas tárāya káṃ  turvī́taye ca vayyā̀ya ca srutím  nīcā́ sántam úd anayaḥ parāvŕ̥jam  prā́ndháṃ śroṇáṃ śraváyan sā́sy ukthyàḥ

translation.text: Thou for Turvîti heldest still the flowing floods, the river-stream for Vayya easily to pass Didst raise the outcast from the depths, and gavest fame unto the halt and blind. Worthy of lauds art thou.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒स्मभ्यं॒ तद्व॑सो दा॒नाय॒ राधः॒ सम॑र्थयस्व ब॒हु ते॑ वस॒व्य॑म् इन्द्र॒ यच्चि॒त्रं श्र॑व॒स्या अनु॒ द्यून्बृ॒हद्व॑देम वि॒दथे॑ सु॒वीराः॑
verses.transliteration: asmábhyaṃ tád vaso dānā́ya rā́dhaḥ  sám arthayasva bahú te vasavyàm  índra yác citráṃ śravasyā́ ánu dyū́n  br̥hád vadema vidáthe suvī́rāḥ

translation.text: Prepare thyself to grant us that great bounty, O Vasu, for abundant is thy treasure. Snatch up the wonderful, O Indra, daily. Loud may we speak, with heroes, in assembly.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अध्व॑र्यवो॒ भर॒तेन्द्रा॑य॒ सोम॒माम॑त्रेभिः सिञ्चता॒ मद्य॒मन्धः॑ का॒मी हि वी॒रः सद॑मस्य पी॒तिं जु॒होत॒ वृष्णे॒ तदिदे॒ष व॑ष्टि
verses.transliteration: ádhvaryavo bháraténdrāya sómam  ā́matrebhiḥ siñcatā mádyam ándhaḥ  kāmī́ hí vīráḥ sádam asya pītíṃ  juhóta vŕ̥ṣṇe tád íd eṣá vaṣṭi

translation.text: MINISTERS, bring the Soma juice for Indra, pour forth the gladdening liquor with the beakers.logeth ever To drink of this the Hero offer it to the Bull, for this he willeth.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अध्व॑र्यवो॒ यो अ॒पो व॑व्रि॒वांसं॑ वृ॒त्रं ज॒घाना॒शन्ये॑व वृ॒क्षम् तस्मा॑ ए॒तं भ॑रत तद्व॒शायँ॑ ए॒ष इन्द्रो॑ अर्हति पी॒तिम॑स्य
verses.transliteration: ádhvaryavo yó apó vavrivā́ṃsaṃ  vr̥tráṃ jaghā́nāśányeva vr̥kṣám  tásmā etám bharata tadvaśā́yam̐  eṣá índro arhati pītím asya

translation.text: Ye ministers, to him who with the lightning smote, like a tree, the rain-withholding Vr̥itra- Bring it to him, him who is fain to taste it, a draught of this which Indra here deserveth.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अध्व॑र्यवो॒ यो दृभी॑कं ज॒घान॒ यो गा उ॒दाज॒दप॒ हि व॒लं वः तस्मा॑ ए॒तम॒न्तरि॑क्षे॒ न वात॒मिन्द्रं॒ सोमै॒रोर्णु॑त॒ जूर्न वस्त्रैः॑
verses.transliteration: ádhvaryavo yó dŕ̥bhīkaṃ jaghā́na  yó gā́ udā́jad ápa hí valáṃ váḥ  tásmā etám antárikṣe ná vā́tam  índraṃ sómair órṇuta jū́r ná vástraiḥ

translation.text: Ye ministers, to him who smote Dr̥ibhîkas who drove the kine forth, and discovered Vala, Offer this draught, like Vita in the region: clothe him with Soma even as steeds with trappings.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अध्व॑र्यवो॒ य उर॑णं ज॒घान॒ नव॑ च॒ख्वांसं॑ नव॒तिं च॑ बा॒हून् यो अर्बु॑द॒मव॑ नी॒चा ब॑बा॒धे तमिन्द्रं॒ सोम॑स्य भृ॒थे हि॑नोत
verses.transliteration: ádhvaryavo yá úraṇaṃ jaghā́na  náva cakhvā́ṃsaṃ navatíṃ ca bāhū́n  yó árbudam áva nīcā́ babādhé  tám índraṃ sómasya bhr̥thé hinota

translation.text: Him who did Uraṇa to death, Adhvaryus! though showing arms ninety-and-nine in number; Who cast down headlong Arbuda and slew him,– speed ye that Indra to our offered Soma.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अध्व॑र्यवो॒ यः स्वश्नं॑ ज॒घान॒ यः शुष्ण॑म॒शुषं॒ यो व्यं॑सम् यः पिप्रुं॒ नमु॑चिं॒ यो रु॑धि॒क्रां तस्मा॒ इन्द्रा॒यान्ध॑सो जुहोत
verses.transliteration: ádhvaryavo yáḥ sv áśnaṃ jaghā́na  yáḥ śúṣṇam aśúṣaṃ yó vyàṃsam  yáḥ pípruṃ námuciṃ yó rudhikrā́ṃ  tásmā índrāyā́ndhaso juhota

translation.text: Ye ministers, to him who struck down Svaṣna, and did to death Vyansa and greedy Ṣushṇa, And Rudhikrâs and Namuchi and Pipru,– to him, to Indra, pour ye forth libation.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अध्व॑र्यवो॒ यः श॒तं शम्ब॑रस्य॒ पुरो॑ बि॒भेदाश्म॑नेव पू॒र्वीः यो व॒र्चिनः॑ श॒तमिन्द्रः॑ स॒हस्र॑म॒पाव॑प॒द्भर॑ता॒ सोम॑मस्मै
verses.transliteration: ádhvaryavo yáḥ śatáṃ śámbarasya  púro bibhédā́śmaneva pūrvī́ḥ  yó varcínaḥ śatám índraḥ sahásram  apā́vapad bháratā sómam asmai

translation.text: Ye ministers, to him who as with thunder demolished Ṣambara's hundred ancient castles; Who cast down Varcin's sons, a hundred thousand,– to him, to Indra, offer ye the Soma.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अध्व॑र्यवो॒ यः श॒तमा स॒हस्रं॒ भूम्या॑ उ॒पस्थेऽव॑पज्जघ॒न्वान् कुत्स॑स्या॒योर॑तिथि॒ग्वस्य॑ वी॒रान्न्यावृ॑ण॒ग्भर॑ता॒ सोम॑मस्मै
verses.transliteration: ádhvaryavo yáḥ śatám ā́ sahásram  bhū́myā upásthé 'vapaj jaghanvā́n  kútsasyāyór atithigvásya vīrā́n  ny ā́vr̥ṇag bháratā sómam asmai

translation.text: Ye ministers, to him who slew a hundred thousand, and cast them down upon earth's bosom; Who quelled the valiant men of Âtithigva, Kutsa, and Âyu,– bring to him the Soma.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अध्व॑र्यवो॒ यन्न॑रः का॒मया॑ध्वे श्रु॒ष्टी वह॑न्तो नशथा॒ तदिन्द्रे॑ गभ॑स्तिपूतं भरत श्रु॒तायेन्द्रा॑य॒ सोमं॑ यज्यवो जुहोत
verses.transliteration: ádhvaryavo yán naraḥ kāmáyādhve  śruṣṭī́ váhanto naśathā tád índre  gábhastipūtam bharata śrutā́ya-  -índrāya sómaṃ yajyavo juhota

translation.text: Ministers, men, whatever thing ye long for obtain ye quickly bringing gifts to Indra. Bring to the Glorious One what bands have cleansed; to Indra bring, ye pious ones, the Soma.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अध्व॑र्यवः॒ कर्त॑ना श्रु॒ष्टिम॑स्मै॒ वने॒ निपू॑तं॒ वन॒ उन्न॑यध्वम् जु॒षा॒णो हस्त्य॑म॒भि वा॑वशे व॒ इन्द्रा॑य॒ सोमं॑ मदि॒रं जु॑होत
verses.transliteration: ádhvaryavaḥ kártanā śruṣṭím asmai  váne nípūtaṃ vána ún nayadhvam  juṣāṇó hástyam abhí vāvaśe vaḥ-  índrāya sómam madiráṃ juhota

translation.text: Do ye, O ministers, obey his order: that purified in wood, in wood uplift ye. Well pleased he longs for what your hands have tended: offer the gladdening Soma juice to Indra.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अध्व॑र्यवः॒ पय॒सोध॒र्यथा॒ गोः सोमे॑भिरीं पृणता भो॒जमिन्द्र॑म् वेदा॒हम॑स्य॒ निभृ॑तं म ए॒तद्दित्स॑न्तं॒ भूयो॑ यज॒तश्चि॑केत
verses.transliteration: ádhvaryavaḥ páyasódhar yáthā góḥ  sómebhir īm pr̥ṇatā bhojám índram  védāhám asya níbhr̥tam ma etád  dítsantam bhū́yo yajatáś ciketa

translation.text: As the cow's udder teems with milk, Adhvaryus, so fill with Soma Indra, liberal giver. I know him: I am sure of this, the Holy knows that I fain would give to him more largely.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अध्व॑र्यवो॒ यो दि॒व्यस्य॒ वस्वो॒ यः पार्थि॑वस्य॒ क्षम्य॑स्य॒ राजा॑ तमूर्द॑रं॒ न पृ॑णता॒ यवे॒नेन्द्रं॒ सोमे॑भि॒स्तदपो॑ वो अस्तु
verses.transliteration: ádhvaryavo yó divyásya vásvo  yáḥ pā́rthivasya kṣámyasya rā́jā  tám ū́rdaraṃ ná pr̥ṇatā yávena-  -índraṃ sómebhis tád ápo vo astu

translation.text: Him, ministers, the Lord of heavenly treasure and all terrestrial wealth that earth possesses, Him, Indra, fill with Soma as a garner is filled with barley full: be this your labour.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒स्मभ्यं॒ तद्व॑सो दा॒नाय॒ राधः॒ सम॑र्थयस्व ब॒हु ते॑ वस॒व्य॑म् इन्द्र॒ यच्चि॒त्रं श्र॑व॒स्या अनु॒ द्यून्बृ॒हद्व॑देम वि॒दथे॑ सु॒वीराः॑
verses.transliteration: asmábhyaṃ tád vaso dānā́ya rā́dhaḥ  sám arthayasva bahú te vasavyàm  índra yác citráṃ śravasyā́ ánu dyū́n  br̥hád vadema vidáthe suvī́rāḥ

translation.text: Prepare thyself to grant us that great booty, O Vasu, for abundant is thy treasure. Gather up wondrous wealth, O Indra, daily. Loud may we speak, with heroes, in assembly.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र घा॒ न्व॑स्य मह॒तो म॒हानि॑ स॒त्या स॒त्यस्य॒ कर॑णानि वोचम् त्रिक॑द्रुकेष्वपिबत्सु॒तस्या॒स्य मदे॒ अहि॒मिन्द्रो॑ जघान
verses.transliteration: prá ghā nv àsya maható mahā́ni  satyā́ satyásya káraṇāni vocam  tríkadrukeṣv apibat sutásya  -asyá máde áhim índro jaghāna

translation.text: Now, verily, will I declare the exploits, mighty and true, of him the True and Mighty. In the Trikadrukas he drank the Soma then in its rapture Indra slew the Dragon.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒वं॒शे द्याम॑स्तभायद्बृ॒हन्त॒मा रोद॑सी अपृणद॒न्तरि॑क्षम् स धा॑रयत्पृथि॒वीं प॒प्रथ॑च्च॒ सोम॑स्य॒ ता मद॒ इन्द्र॑श्चकार
verses.transliteration: avaṃśé dyā́m astabhāyad br̥hántam  ā́ ródasī apr̥ṇad antárikṣam  sá dhārayat pr̥thivī́m papráthac ca  sómasya tā́ máda índraś cakāra

translation.text: High heaven unsupported in space he stablished: he filled the two worlds and the air's mid-region. Earth he upheld, and gave it wide expansion. These things did Indra in the Soma's rapture.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सद्मे॑व॒ प्राचो॒ वि मि॑माय॒ मानै॒र्वज्रे॑ण॒ खान्य॑तृणन्न॒दीना॑म् वृथा॑सृजत्प॒थिभि॑र्दीर्घया॒थैः सोम॑स्य॒ ता मद॒ इन्द्र॑श्चकार
verses.transliteration: sádmeva prā́co ví mimāya mā́nair  vájreṇa khā́ny atr̥ṇan nadī́nām  vŕ̥thāsr̥jat pathíbhir dīrghayāthaíḥ  sómasya tā́ máda índraś cakāra

translation.text: From front, as 'twere a house, he ruled and measured; pierced with his bolt the fountains of the rivers, And made them flow at ease by paths far-reaching, These things did Indra in the Soma's rapture.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स प्र॑वो॒ळ्हॄन्प॑रि॒गत्या॑ द॒भीते॒र्विश्व॑मधा॒गायु॑धमि॒द्धे अ॒ग्नौ सं गोभि॒रश्वै॑रसृज॒द्रथे॑भिः॒ सोम॑स्य॒ ता मद॒ इन्द्र॑श्चकार
verses.transliteration: sá pravoḷhr̥̄́n parigátyā dabhī́ter  víśvam adhāg ā́yudham iddhé agnaú  sáṃ góbhir áśvair asr̥jad ráthebhiḥ  sómasya tā́ máda índraś cakāra

translation.text: Compassing those who bore away Dabhîti, in kindled fire he burnt up all their weapons. And made him rich with kine and cars and horses. These things did Indra in the Soma's rapture.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स ईं॑ म॒हीं धुनि॒मेतो॑ररम्णा॒त्सो अ॑स्ना॒तॄन॑पारयत्स्व॒स्ति त उ॒त्स्नाय॑ र॒यिम॒भि प्र त॑स्थुः॒ सोम॑स्य॒ ता मद॒ इन्द्र॑श्चकार
verses.transliteration: sá īm mahī́ṃ dhúnim étor aramṇāt  só asnātr̥̄́n apārayat svastí  tá utsnā́ya rayím abhí prá tasthuḥ  sómasya tā́ máda índraś cakāra

translation.text: The mighty roaring flood he stayed from flowing, and carried those who swam not safely over. They having crossed the stream attained to riches. These things did Indra in the Soma's rapture.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सोद॑ञ्चं॒ सिन्धु॑मरिणान्महि॒त्वा वज्रे॒णान॑ उ॒षसः॒ सं पि॑पेष अ॒ज॒वसो॑ ज॒विनी॑भिर्विवृ॒श्चन्त्सोम॑स्य॒ ता मद॒ इन्द्र॑श्चकार
verses.transliteration: sódañcaṃ síndhum ariṇān mahitvā́  vájreṇā́na uṣásaḥ sám pipeṣa  ajaváso javínībhir vivr̥ścán  sómasya tā́ máda índraś cakāra

translation.text: With mighty power he made the stream flow upward, crushed with his thunderbolt the car of Ushas, Rending her slow steeds with his rapid coursers. These things did Indra in the Soma's rapture.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स वि॒द्वाँ अ॑पगो॒हं क॒नीना॑मा॒विर्भव॒न्नुद॑तिष्ठत्परा॒वृक् प्रति॑ श्रो॒णः स्था॒द्व्य१॒॑नग॑चष्ट॒ सोम॑स्य॒ ता मद॒ इन्द्र॑श्चकार
verses.transliteration: sá vidvā́m̐ apagoháṃ kanī́nām  āvír bhávann úd atiṣṭhat parāvŕ̥k  práti śroṇá sthād vy ànág acaṣṭa  sómasya tā́ máda índraś cakāra

translation.text: Knowing the place wherein the maids were hiding, the outcast showed himself and stood before them. The cripple stood erect, the blind beheld them. These things did Indra in the Soma's rapture.

verses.sanskrit_deva: भि॒नद्व॒लमङ्गि॑रोभिर्गृणा॒नो वि पर्व॑तस्य दृंहि॒तान्यै॑रत् रि॒णग्रोधां॑सि कृ॒त्रिमा॑ण्येषां॒ सोम॑स्य॒ ता मद॒ इन्द्र॑श्चकार
verses.transliteration: bhinád valám áṅgirobhir gr̥ṇānó  ví párvatasya dr̥ṃhitā́ny airat  riṇág ródhāṃsi kr̥trímāṇy eṣāṃ  sómasya tā́ máda índraś cakāra

translation.text: Praised by the Angirases he slaughtered Vala, and burst apart the bulwarks of the mountain. He tore away their deftly-built defences. These things did Indra in the Soma's rapture.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स्वप्ने॑ना॒भ्युप्या॒ चुमु॑रिं॒ धुनिं॑ च ज॒घन्थ॒ दस्युं॒ प्र द॒भीति॑मावः र॒म्भी चि॒दत्र॑ विविदे॒ हिर॑ण्यं॒ सोम॑स्य॒ ता मद॒ इन्द्र॑श्चकार
verses.transliteration: svápnenābhyúpyā cúmuriṃ dhúniṃ ca  jaghántha dásyum prá dabhī́tim āvaḥ  rambhī́ cid átra vivide híraṇyaṃ  sómasya tā́ máda índraś cakāra

translation.text: Thou, with sleep whelming Chumuri and Dhuni, slewest the Dasyu, keptest safe Dabhîti. There the staff-bearer found the golden treasure. These things did Indra in the Soma's rapture.

verses.sanskrit_deva: नू॒नं सा ते॒ प्रति॒ वरं॑ जरि॒त्रे दु॑ही॒यदि॑न्द्र॒ दक्षि॑णा म॒घोनी॑ शिक्षा॑ स्तो॒तृभ्यो॒ माति॑ ध॒ग्भगो॑ नो बृ॒हद्व॑देम वि॒दथे॑ सु॒वीराः॑
verses.transliteration: nūnáṃ sā́ te práti váraṃ jaritré  duhīyád indra dákṣiṇā maghónī  śíkṣā stotŕ̥bhyo mā́ti dhag bhágo no  br̥hád vadema vidáthe suvī́rāḥ

translation.text: Now let that wealthy Cow of thine, O Indra , yield in return a boon to him who lauds thee. Give to thy praisers: let not fortune fail us. Loud may we speak, with brave men, in assembly.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र वः॑ स॒तां ज्येष्ठ॑तमाय सुष्टु॒तिम॒ग्नावि॑व समिधा॒ने ह॒विर्भ॑रे इन्द्र॑मजु॒र्यं ज॒रय॑न्तमुक्षि॒तं स॒नाद्युवा॑न॒मव॑से हवामहे
verses.transliteration: prá vaḥ satā́ṃ jyéṣṭhatamāya suṣṭutím  agnā́v iva samidhāné havír bhare  índram ajuryáṃ jaráyantam ukṣitáṃ  sanā́d yúvānam ávase havāmahe

translation.text: To him, your own, the best among the good, I bring eulogy, like oblation in the kindled fire. We invocate for help Indra untouched by eld, who maketh all decay, strengthened, for ever young.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यस्मा॒दिन्द्रा॑द्बृह॒तः किं च॒नेमृ॒ते विश्वा॑न्यस्मि॒न्त्सम्भृ॒ताधि॑ वी॒र्या॑ ज॒ठरे॒ सोमं॑ त॒न्वी॒३॒॑ सहो॒ महो॒ हस्ते॒ वज्रं॒ भर॑ति शी॒र्षणि॒ क्रतु॑म्
verses.transliteration: yásmād índrād br̥hatáḥ kíṃ caném r̥té  víśvāny asmin sámbhr̥tā́dhi vīryā̀  jaṭháre sómaṃ tanvī̀ sáho máho  háste vájram bhárati śīrṣáṇi krátum

translation.text: Without whom naught exists, Indra the Lofty One; in whom alone all powers heroic are combined. The Soma is within him, in his frame vast strength, the thunder in his hand and wisdom in his head.

verses.sanskrit_deva: न क्षो॒णीभ्यां॑ परि॒भ्वे॑ त इन्द्रि॒यं न स॑मु॒द्रैः पर्व॑तैरिन्द्र ते॒ रथः॑ न ते॒ वज्र॒मन्व॑श्नोति॒ कश्च॒न यदा॒शुभिः॒ पत॑सि॒ योज॑ना पु॒रु
verses.transliteration: ná kṣoṇī́bhyām paribhvè ta indriyáṃ  ná samudraíḥ párvatair indra te ráthaḥ  ná te vájram ánv aśnoti káś caná  yád āśúbhiḥ pátasi yójanā purú

translation.text: Not by both worlds is thine own power to be surpassed, nor may thy car be stayed by mountains or by seas. None cometh near, O Indra, to thy thunderbolt, when with swift steeds thou fliest over many a league.

verses.sanskrit_deva: विश्वे॒ ह्य॑स्मै यज॒ताय॑ धृ॒ष्णवे॒ क्रतुं॒ भर॑न्ति वृष॒भाय॒ सश्च॑ते वृषा॑ यजस्व ह॒विषा॑ वि॒दुष्ट॑रः॒ पिबे॑न्द्र॒ सोमं॑ वृष॒भेण॑ भा॒नुना॑
verses.transliteration: víśve hy àsmai yajatā́ya dhr̥ṣṇáve  krátum bháranti vr̥ṣabhā́ya sáścate  vŕ̥ṣā yajasva havíṣā vidúṣṭaraḥ  píbendra sómaṃ vr̥ṣabhéṇa bhānúnā

translation.text: For all men bring their will to him the Resolute, to him the Holy One, to him the Strong they cleave. Pay worship with oblation, strong and passing wise. Drink thou the Soma, Indra, through the mighty blaze.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वृष्णः॒ कोशः॑ पवते॒ मध्व॑ ऊ॒र्मिर्वृ॑ष॒भान्ना॑य वृष॒भाय॒ पात॑वे वृष॑णाध्व॒र्यू वृ॑ष॒भासो॒ अद्र॑यो॒ वृष॑णं॒ सोमं॑ वृष॒भाय॑ सुष्वति
