verses.sanskrit_deva: सिनी॑वालि॒ पृथु॑ष्टुके॒ या दे॒वाना॒मसि॒ स्वसा॑ जु॒षस्व॑ ह॒व्यमाहु॑तं प्र॒जां दे॑वि दिदिड्ढि नः
verses.transliteration: sínīvāli pŕ̥thuṣṭuke  yā́ devā́nām ási svásā  juṣásva havyám ā́hutam  prajā́ṃ devi didiḍḍhi naḥ

translation.text: O broad-tressed Sinîvâlî, thou who art the Sister of the Gods, Accept the offered sacrifice, and, Goddess, grant us progeny.

verses.sanskrit_deva: या सु॑बा॒हुः स्व॑ङ्गु॒रिः सु॒षूमा॑ बहु॒सूव॑री तस्यै॑ वि॒श्पत्न्यै॑ ह॒विः सि॑नीवा॒ल्यै जु॑होतन
verses.transliteration: yā́ subāhúḥ svaṅguríḥ  suṣū́mā bahusū́varī  tásyai viśpátnyai havíḥ  sinīvālyaí juhotana

translation.text: With lovely fingers, lovely arms, prolific Mother of many sons- Present the sacred gifts to her, to Sinîvâlî Queen of men.

verses.sanskrit_deva: या गु॒ङ्गूर्या सि॑नीवा॒ली या रा॒का या सर॑स्वती इ॒न्द्रा॒णीम॑ह्व ऊ॒तये॑ वरुणा॒नीं स्व॒स्तये॑
verses.transliteration: yā́ guṅgū́r yā́ sinīvālī́  yā́ rākā́ yā́ sárasvatī  indrāṇī́m ahva ūtáye  varuṇānī́ṃ svastáye

translation.text: Her, Sinîvâlî, her, Gungû, her, Râkâ, her, Sarasvatî, Indrâṇî to mine aid I call, and Vartunani for my weal.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ ते॑ पितर्मरुतां सु॒म्नमे॑तु॒ मा नः॒ सूर्य॑स्य सं॒दृशो॑ युयोथाः अ॒भि नो॑ वी॒रो अर्व॑ति क्षमेत॒ प्र जा॑येमहि रुद्र प्र॒जाभिः॑
verses.transliteration: ā́ te pitar marutāṃ sumnám etu  mā́ naḥ sū́ryasya saṃdŕ̥śo yuyothāḥ  abhí no vīró árvati kṣameta  prá jāyemahi rudra prajā́bhiḥ

translation.text: FATHER of Maruts, let thy bliss approach us: exclude us not from looking on the sunlight. Gracious to our fleet courser be the Hero may we transplant us, Rudra, in our children.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वाद॑त्तेभी रुद्र॒ शंत॑मेभिः श॒तं हिमा॑ अशीय भेष॒जेभिः॑ व्य१॒॑स्मद्द्वेषो॑ वित॒रं व्यंहो॒ व्यमी॑वाश्चातयस्वा॒ विषू॑चीः
verses.transliteration: tvā́dattebhī rudra śáṃtamebhiḥ  śatáṃ hímā aśīya bheṣajébhiḥ  vy àsmád dvéṣo vitaráṃ vy áṃho  vy ámīvāś cātayasvā víṣūcīḥ

translation.text: With the most saving medicines which thou givest, Rudra, may I attain a hundred winters. Far from us banish enmity and hatred, and to all quarters maladies and trouble.

verses.sanskrit_deva: श्रेष्ठो॑ जा॒तस्य॑ रुद्र श्रि॒यासि॑ त॒वस्त॑मस्त॒वसां॑ वज्रबाहो पर्षि॑ णः पा॒रमंह॑सः स्व॒स्ति विश्वा॑ अ॒भी॑ती॒ रप॑सो युयोधि
verses.transliteration: śréṣṭho jātásya rudra śriyā́si  tavástamas tavásāṃ vajrabāho  párṣi ṇaḥ pārám áṃhasaḥ svastí  víśvā abhī̀tī rápaso yuyodhi

translation.text: Chief of all born art thou in glory, Rudra, armed with the thunder, mightiest of the mighty. Transport us over trouble to well-being repel thou from us all assaults of mis. chief.

verses.sanskrit_deva: मा त्वा॑ रुद्र चुक्रुधामा॒ नमो॑भि॒र्मा दुष्टु॑ती वृषभ॒ मा सहू॑ती उन्नो॑ वी॒राँ अ॑र्पय भेष॒जेभि॑र्भि॒षक्त॑मं त्वा भि॒षजां॑ शृणोमि
verses.transliteration: mā́ tvā rudra cukrudhāmā námobhir  mā́ dúṣṭutī vr̥ṣabha mā́ sáhūtī  ún no vīrā́m̐ arpaya bheṣajébhir  bhiṣáktamaṃ tvā bhiṣájāṃ śr̥ṇomi

translation.text: Let us not anger thee with worship, Rudra, ill praise, Strong God! or mingled invocation. Do thou with strengthening balms incite our heroes: I hear thee famed as best of all physicians.

verses.sanskrit_deva: हवी॑मभि॒र्हव॑ते॒ यो ह॒विर्भि॒रव॒ स्तोमे॑भी रु॒द्रं दि॑षीय ऋ॒दू॒दरः॑ सु॒हवो॒ मा नो॑ अ॒स्यै ब॒भ्रुः सु॒शिप्रो॑ रीरधन्म॒नायै॑
verses.transliteration: hávīmabhir hávate yó havírbhir  áva stómebhī rudráṃ diṣīya  r̥dūdáraḥ suhávo mā́ no asyaí  babhrúḥ suśípro rīradhan manā́yai

translation.text: May I with praise-songs win that Rudra's favour who is adored with gifts and invocations. Ne'er may the tawny God, fair-checked, and gracious, swifthearing, yield us to this evil purpose.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उन्मा॑ ममन्द वृष॒भो म॒रुत्वा॒न्त्वक्षी॑यसा॒ वय॑सा॒ नाध॑मानम् घृणी॑व च्छा॒याम॑र॒पा अ॑शी॒या वि॑वासेयं रु॒द्रस्य॑ सु॒म्नम्
verses.transliteration: ún mā mamanda vr̥ṣabhó marútvān  tvákṣīyasā váyasā nā́dhamānam  ghŕ̥ṇīva chāyā́m arapā́ aśīya-  -ā́ vivāseyaṃ rudrásya sumnám

translation.text: The Strong, begirt by Maruts, hath refreshed me, with most invigorating food, imploring. As he who finds a shade in fervent sunlight may I, uninjured, win the bliss of Rudra.

verses.sanskrit_deva: क्व१॒॑ स्य ते॑ रुद्र मृळ॒याकु॒र्हस्तो॒ यो अस्ति॑ भेष॒जो जला॑षः अ॒प॒भ॒र्ता रप॑सो॒ दैव्य॑स्या॒भी नु मा॑ वृषभ चक्षमीथाः
verses.transliteration: kvà syá te rudra mr̥ḷayā́kur  hásto yó ásti bheṣajó jálāṣaḥ  apabhartā́ rápaso daívyasya-  -abhī́ nú mā vr̥ṣabha cakṣamīthāḥ

translation.text: Where is that gracious hand of thine, O Rudra, the hand that giveth health and bringeth comfort, Remover of the woe that Gods have sent us? O Strong One, look thou on me with compassion.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र ब॒भ्रवे॑ वृष॒भाय॑ श्विती॒चे म॒हो म॒हीं सु॑ष्टु॒तिमी॑रयामि न॒म॒स्या क॑ल्मली॒किनं॒ नमो॑भिर्गृणी॒मसि॑ त्वे॒षं रु॒द्रस्य॒ नाम॑
verses.transliteration: prá babhráve vr̥ṣabhā́ya śvitīcé  mahó mahī́ṃ suṣṭutím īrayāmi  namasyā́ kalmalīkínaṃ námobhir  gr̥ṇīmási tveṣáṃ rudrásya nā́ma

translation.text: To him the strong, great, tawny, fair-complexioned, I utter forth a mighty hymn of praises. We serve the brilliant God with adorations, we glorify, the splendid name of Rudra.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स्थि॒रेभि॒रङ्गैः॑ पुरु॒रूप॑ उ॒ग्रो ब॒भ्रुः शु॒क्रेभिः॑ पिपिशे॒ हिर॑ण्यैः ईशा॑नाद॒स्य भुव॑नस्य॒ भूरे॒र्न वा उ॑ योषद्रु॒द्राद॑सु॒र्य॑म्
verses.transliteration: sthirébhir áṅgaiḥ pururū́pa ugró  babhrúḥ śukrébhiḥ pipiśe híraṇyaiḥ  ī́śānād asyá bhúvanasya bhū́rer  ná vā́ u yoṣad rudrā́d asuryàm

translation.text: With firm limbs, multiform, the strong, the tawny adorns himself with bright gold decorations: The strength of Godhead ne'er departs from Rudra, him who is Sovran of this world, the mighty.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अर्ह॑न्बिभर्षि॒ साय॑कानि॒ धन्वार्ह॑न्नि॒ष्कं य॑ज॒तं वि॒श्वरू॑पम् अर्ह॑न्नि॒दं द॑यसे॒ विश्व॒मभ्वं॒ न वा ओजी॑यो रुद्र॒ त्वद॑स्ति
verses.transliteration: árhan bibharṣi sā́yakāni dhánva-  -árhan niṣkáṃ yajatáṃ viśvárūpam  árhann idáṃ dayase víśvam ábhvaṃ  ná vā́ ójīyo rudra tvád asti

translation.text: Worthy, thou carriest thy bow and arrows, worthy, thy manyhued and honoured necklace. Worthy, thou cuttest here each fiend to pieces: a mightier than thou there is not, Rudra.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स्तु॒हि श्रु॒तं ग॑र्त॒सदं॒ युवा॑नं मृ॒गं न भी॒ममु॑पह॒त्नुमु॒ग्रम् मृ॒ळा ज॑रि॒त्रे रु॑द्र॒ स्तवा॑नो॒ऽन्यं ते॑ अ॒स्मन्नि व॑पन्तु॒ सेनाः॑
verses.transliteration: stuhí śrutáṃ gartasádaṃ yúvānam  mr̥gáṃ ná bhīmám upahatnúm ugrám  mr̥ḷā́ jaritré rudra stávāno  -anyáṃ te asmán ní vapantu sénāḥ

translation.text: Praise him the chariot-borne, the young, the famous, fierce, slaying like a dread beast of the forest. O Rudra, praised, be gracious to the singer. let thy hosts spare us and smite down another.

verses.sanskrit_deva: कु॒मा॒रश्चि॑त्पि॒तरं॒ वन्द॑मानं॒ प्रति॑ नानाम रुद्रोप॒यन्त॑म् भूरे॑र्दा॒तारं॒ सत्प॑तिं गृणीषे स्तु॒तस्त्वं भे॑ष॒जा रा॑स्य॒स्मे
verses.transliteration: kumāráś cit pitáraṃ vándamānam  práti nānāma rudropayántam  bhū́rer dātā́raṃ sátpatiṃ gr̥ṇīṣe  stutás tvám bheṣajā́ rāsy asmé

translation.text: I bend to thee as thou approachest, Rudra, even as a boy before the sire who greets him. I praise thee Bounteous Giver, Lord of heroes: give medicines to us as thou art lauded.

verses.sanskrit_deva: या वो॑ भेष॒जा म॑रुतः॒ शुची॑नि॒ या शंत॑मा वृषणो॒ या म॑यो॒भु यानि॒ मनु॒रवृ॑णीता पि॒ता न॒स्ता शं च॒ योश्च॑ रु॒द्रस्य॑ वश्मि
verses.transliteration: yā́ vo bheṣajā́ marutaḥ śúcīni  yā́ śáṃtamā vr̥ṣaṇo yā́ mayobhú  yā́ni mánur ávr̥ṇītā pitā́ nas  tā́ śáṃ ca yóś ca rudrásya vaśmi

translation.text: Of your pure medicines, O potent Martits, those that are wholesomest and healthbestowing, Those which our father Manu hath selected, I crave from. Rudra for our gain and welfare.

verses.sanskrit_deva: परि॑ णो हे॒ती रु॒द्रस्य॑ वृज्याः॒ परि॑ त्वे॒षस्य॑ दुर्म॒तिर्म॒ही गा॑त् अव॑ स्थि॒रा म॒घव॑द्भ्यस्तनुष्व॒ मीढ्व॑स्तो॒काय॒ तन॑याय मृळ
verses.transliteration: pári ṇo hetī́ rudrásya vr̥jyāḥ  pári tveṣásya durmatír mahī́ gāt  áva sthirā́ maghávadbhyas tanuṣva  mī́ḍhvas tokā́ya tánayāya mr̥ḷa

translation.text: May Rudra's missile turn aside and spare us, the great wrath of the impetuous One avoid us. Turn, Bounteous God, thy strong bow from our princes, and be thou gracious to our seed and offspring.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ए॒वा ब॑भ्रो वृषभ चेकितान॒ यथा॑ देव॒ न हृ॑णी॒षे न हंसि॑ ह॒व॒न॒श्रुन्नो॑ रुद्रे॒ह बो॑धि बृ॒हद्व॑देम वि॒दथे॑ सु॒वीराः॑
verses.transliteration: evā́ babhro vr̥ṣabha cekitāna  yáthā deva ná hr̥ṇīṣé ná háṃsi  havanaśrún no rudrehá bodhi  br̥hád vadema vidáthe suvī́rāḥ

translation.text: O tawny Bull, thus showing forth thy nature, as neither to be wroth, O God, nor slay us. Here, Rudra, listen to our invocation. Loud may we speak, with heroes, in assembly.

verses.sanskrit_deva: धा॒रा॒व॒रा म॒रुतो॑ धृ॒ष्ण्वो॑जसो मृ॒गा न भी॒मास्तवि॑षीभिर॒र्चिनः॑ अ॒ग्नयो॒ न शु॑शुचा॒ना ऋ॑जी॒षिणो॒ भृमिं॒ धम॑न्तो॒ अप॒ गा अ॑वृण्वत
verses.transliteration: dhārāvarā́ marúto dhr̥ṣṇvòjaso  mr̥gā́ ná bhīmā́s táviṣībhir arcínaḥ  agnáyo ná śuśucānā́ r̥jīṣíṇo  bhŕ̥miṃ dhámanto ápa gā́ avr̥ṇvata

translation.text: THE Maruts of resistless might who love the rain, resplendent, terrible like wild beasts in their strength, Glowing like flames of fire, impetuous in career, blowing the wandering raincloud, have disclosed the kine.

verses.sanskrit_deva: द्यावो॒ न स्तृभि॑श्चितयन्त खा॒दिनो॒ व्य१॒॑भ्रिया॒ न द्यु॑तयन्त वृ॒ष्टयः॑ रु॒द्रो यद्वो॑ मरुतो रुक्मवक्षसो॒ वृषाज॑नि॒ पृश्न्याः॑ शु॒क्र ऊध॑नि
verses.transliteration: dyā́vo ná stŕ̥bhiś citayanta khādíno  vy àbhríyā ná dyutayanta vr̥ṣṭáyaḥ  rudró yád vo maruto rukmavakṣaso  vŕ̥ṣā́jani pŕ̥śnyāḥ śukrá ū́dhani

translation.text: They gleam with armlets as the heavens are decked with stars, like cloud-born lightnings shine the torrents of their rain. Since the strong Rudra, O Maruts with brilliant chests, sprang into life for you in Pr̥iṣni's radiant lap.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उ॒क्षन्ते॒ अश्वाँ॒ अत्याँ॑ इवा॒जिषु॑ न॒दस्य॒ कर्णै॑स्तुरयन्त आ॒शुभिः॑ हिर॑ण्यशिप्रा मरुतो॒ दवि॑ध्वतः पृ॒क्षं या॑थ॒ पृष॑तीभिः समन्यवः
verses.transliteration: ukṣánte áśvām̐ átyām̐ ivājíṣu  nadásya kárṇais turayanta āśúbhiḥ  híraṇyaśiprā maruto dávidhvataḥ  pr̥kṣáṃ yātha pŕ̥ṣatībhiḥ samanyavaḥ

translation.text: They drip like horses in the racings of swift steeds; with the stream's rapid cars they hasten on their way. Maruts with helms of gold, ye who make all things shake, con e with your spotted deer, one-minded, to our food.

verses.sanskrit_deva: पृ॒क्षे ता विश्वा॒ भुव॑ना ववक्षिरे मि॒त्राय॑ वा॒ सद॒मा जी॒रदा॑नवः पृष॑दश्वासो अनव॒भ्ररा॑धस ऋजि॒प्यासो॒ न व॒युने॑षु धू॒र्षदः॑
verses.transliteration: pr̥kṣé tā́ víśvā bhúvanā vavakṣire  mitrā́ya vā sádam ā́ jīrádānavaḥ  pŕ̥ṣadaśvāso anavabhrárādhasaḥ-  r̥jipyā́so ná vayúneṣu dhūrṣádaḥ

translation.text: They have bestowed of Mitra all that live, to feed, they who for evermore cause their swift drops to flow; Whose steeds are spotted deer, whose riches never fail, like horses in full speed, bound to the pole in work.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इन्ध॑न्वभिर्धे॒नुभी॑ र॒प्शदू॑धभिरध्व॒स्मभिः॑ प॒थिभि॑र्भ्राजदृष्टयः आ हं॒सासो॒ न स्वस॑राणि गन्तन॒ मधो॒र्मदा॑य मरुतः समन्यवः
verses.transliteration: índhanvabhir dhenúbhī rapśádūdhabhir  adhvasmábhiḥ pathíbhir bhrājadr̥ṣṭayaḥ  ā́ haṃsā́so ná svásarāṇi gantana  mádhor mádāya marutaḥ samanyavaḥ

translation.text: With brightly-flarning kine whose udders swell with milk, idth glittering lances on your unobstructed paths, O Maruts, of one mind, like swans who seek their nests, come to the rapturous enjoyment of the meath.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ नो॒ ब्रह्मा॑णि मरुतः समन्यवो न॒रां न शंसः॒ सव॑नानि गन्तन अश्वा॑मिव पिप्यत धे॒नुमूध॑नि॒ कर्ता॒ धियं॑ जरि॒त्रे वाज॑पेशसम्
verses.transliteration: ā́ no bráhmāṇi marutaḥ samanyavo  narā́ṃ ná śáṃsaḥ sávanāni gantana  áśvām iva pipyata dhenúm ū́dhani  kártā dhíyaṃ jaritré vā́japeśasam

translation.text: To these our prayers, O Maruts, come unanimous, come ye to our libations like the praise of men. Make it swell like a mare, in udder like a cow, and for the singer grace the song with plenteous strength.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तं नो॑ दात मरुतो वा॒जिनं॒ रथ॑ आपा॒नं ब्रह्म॑ चि॒तय॑द्दि॒वेदि॑वे इषं॑ स्तो॒तृभ्यो॑ वृ॒जने॑षु का॒रवे॑ स॒निं मे॒धामरि॑ष्टं दु॒ष्टरं॒ सहः॑
verses.transliteration: táṃ no dāta maruto vājínaṃ ráthe-  āpānám bráhma citáyad divé-dive  íṣaṃ stotŕ̥bhyo vr̥jáneṣu kāráve  saním medhā́m áriṣṭaṃ duṣṭáraṃ sáhaḥ

translation.text: Give us a steed, O Maruts migbty in the car; prevailing prayer that brings remembrance day by day; Food to your praisers, to your bard in deeds of might give winning wisdom, power uninjured, unsurpassed.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यद्यु॒ञ्जते॑ म॒रुतो॑ रु॒क्मव॑क्ष॒सोऽश्वा॒न्रथे॑षु॒ भग॒ आ सु॒दान॑वः धे॒नुर्न शिश्वे॒ स्वस॑रेषु पिन्वते॒ जना॑य रा॒तह॑विषे म॒हीमिष॑म्
verses.transliteration: yád yuñjáte marúto rukmávakṣasaḥ-  -áśvān rátheṣu bhága ā́ sudā́navaḥ  dhenúr ná śíśve svásareṣu pinvate  jánāya rātáhaviṣe mahī́m íṣam

translation.text: When the bright-chested Maruts, lavish of their gifts, bind at the time bliss their horses to the cars, Then, as the milch-cow feeds her calf within the stalls, they pour forth food for all oblation-bringing men.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यो नो॑ मरुतो वृ॒कता॑ति॒ मर्त्यो॑ रि॒पुर्द॒धे व॑सवो॒ रक्ष॑ता रि॒षः व॒र्तय॑त॒ तपु॑षा च॒क्रिया॒भि तमव॑ रुद्रा अ॒शसो॑ हन्तना॒ वधः॑
verses.transliteration: yó no maruto vr̥kátāti mártyo  ripúr dadhé vasavo rákṣatā riṣáḥ  vartáyata tápuṣā cakríyābhí tám  áva rudrā aśáso hantanā vádhaḥ

translation.text: Save us, O Maruts, Vasus, from the injurer, the mortal foe who makes us looked upon as wolves. With chariot all aflame compass him round about: O Rudras, cast away the foeman's deadly bolt.

verses.sanskrit_deva: चि॒त्रं तद्वो॑ मरुतो॒ याम॑ चेकिते॒ पृश्न्या॒ यदूध॒रप्या॒पयो॑ दु॒हुः यद्वा॑ नि॒दे नव॑मानस्य रुद्रियास्त्रि॒तं जरा॑य जुर॒ताम॑दाभ्याः
verses.transliteration: citráṃ tád vo maruto yā́ma cekite  pŕ̥śnyā yád ū́dhar ápy āpáyo duhúḥ  yád vā nidé návamānasya rudriyās  tritáṃ járāya juratā́m adābhyāḥ

translation.text: Well-known, ye Maruts, is that wondrous course of yours, when they milked Pr̥iṣni's udder, close akin to her. Or when to shame the bard who lauded, Rudra's Sons, ye O infallible brought Trita to decay.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तान्वो॑ म॒हो म॒रुत॑ एव॒याव्नो॒ विष्णो॑रे॒षस्य॑ प्रभृ॒थे ह॑वामहे हिर॑ण्यवर्णान्ककु॒हान्य॒तस्रु॑चो ब्रह्म॒ण्यन्तः॒ शंस्यं॒ राध॑ ईमहे
verses.transliteration: tā́n vo mahó marúta evayā́vno  víṣṇor eṣásya prabhr̥thé havāmahe  híraṇyavarṇān kakuhā́n yatásruco  brahmaṇyántaḥ śáṃsyaṃ rā́dha īmahe

translation.text: We call youi such, great Maruts, following wonted ways, to the oblation paid to Vishṇu Speeder-on. With ladles lifted up, with prayer, we seek of them preeminent, golden-hued, the wealth which all extol.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ते दश॑ग्वाः प्रथ॒मा य॒ज्ञमू॑हिरे॒ ते नो॑ हिन्वन्तू॒षसो॒ व्यु॑ष्टिषु उ॒षा न रा॒मीर॑रु॒णैरपो॑र्णुते म॒हो ज्योति॑षा शुच॒ता गोअ॑र्णसा
verses.transliteration: té dáśagvāḥ prathamā́ yajñám ūhire  té no hinvantūṣáso vyùṣṭiṣu  uṣā́ ná rāmī́r aruṇaír áporṇute  mahó jyótiṣā śucatā́ góarṇasā

translation.text: They, the Daṣagvas, first of all brought sacrifice: they at the break of mornings shall inspirit us. Dawn with her purple beams uncovereth the nights, with great light glowing like a billowy sea of milk.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ते क्षो॒णीभि॑ररु॒णेभि॒र्नाञ्जिभी॑ रु॒द्रा ऋ॒तस्य॒ सद॑नेषु वावृधुः नि॒मेघ॑माना॒ अत्ये॑न॒ पाज॑सा सुश्च॒न्द्रं वर्णं॑ दधिरे सु॒पेश॑सम्
verses.transliteration: té kṣoṇī́bhir aruṇébhir nā́ñjíbhiḥ-  rudrā́ r̥tásya sádaneṣu vāvr̥dhuḥ  niméghamānā átyena pā́jasā  suścandráṃ várṇaṃ dadhire supéśasam

translation.text: The Rudras have rejoiced them in the gathered bands at seats of worship as in purple ornaments. They with impetuous vigour sending down the rain have taken to themselves a bright and lovely hue.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ताँ इ॑या॒नो महि॒ वरू॑थमू॒तय॒ उप॒ घेदे॒ना नम॑सा गृणीमसि त्रि॒तो न यान्पञ्च॒ होतॄ॑न॒भिष्ट॑य आव॒वर्त॒दव॑राञ्च॒क्रियाव॑से
verses.transliteration: tā́m̐ iyānó máhi várūtham ūtáye-  úpa ghéd enā́ námasā gr̥ṇīmasi  tritó ná yā́n páñca hótr̥̄n abhíṣṭaye-  āvavártad ávarāñ cakríyā́vase

translation.text: Soliciting their high protection for our help, with this our adoration we sing praise to them, Whom, for assistance, like the five terrestrial priests. Trita hath brought to aid us hither on his car.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यया॑ र॒ध्रं पा॒रय॒थात्यंहो॒ यया॑ नि॒दो मु॒ञ्चथ॑ वन्दि॒तार॑म् अ॒र्वाची॒ सा म॑रुतो॒ या व॑ ऊ॒तिरो षु वा॒श्रेव॑ सुम॒तिर्जि॑गातु
verses.transliteration: yáyā radhrám pāráyathā́ty áṃho  yáyā nidó muñcátha vanditā́ram  arvā́cī sā́ maruto yā́ va ūtír  ó ṣú vāśréva sumatír jigātu

translation.text: So may your favouring help be turned to us-ward, your kindness like a Iowing cow approach us, Wherewith ye bear your servant over trouble, and free your worshipper from scoff and scorning.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उपे॑मसृक्षि वाज॒युर्व॑च॒स्यां चनो॑ दधीत ना॒द्यो गिरो॑ मे अ॒पां नपा॑दाशु॒हेमा॑ कु॒वित्स सु॒पेश॑सस्करति॒ जोषि॑ष॒द्धि
verses.transliteration: úpem asr̥kṣi vājayúr vacasyā́ṃ  cáno dadhīta nādyó gíro me  apā́ṃ nápād āśuhémā kuvít sá  supéśasas karati jóṣiṣad dhí

translation.text: EAGER for spoil my flow of speech I utter: may the Floods' Child accept my songs with favour. Will not the rapid Son of Waters make them lovely, for he it is who shall enjoy them?

verses.sanskrit_deva: इ॒मं स्व॑स्मै हृ॒द आ सुत॑ष्टं॒ मन्त्रं॑ वोचेम कु॒विद॑स्य॒ वेद॑त् अ॒पां नपा॑दसु॒र्य॑स्य म॒ह्ना विश्वा॑न्य॒र्यो भुव॑ना जजान
verses.transliteration: imáṃ sv àsmai hr̥dá ā́ sútaṣṭam  mántraṃ vocema kuvíd asya védat  apā́ṃ nápād asuryàsya mahnā́  víśvāny aryó bhúvanā jajāna

translation.text: To him let us address the song well-fashioned, forth from the heart. Shall he not understand it' The friendly Son of Waters by the greatness of Godhead hath produced all things existing.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सम॒न्या यन्त्युप॑ यन्त्य॒न्याः स॑मा॒नमू॒र्वं न॒द्यः॑ पृणन्ति तमू॒ शुचिं॒ शुच॑यो दीदि॒वांस॑म॒पां नपा॑तं॒ परि॑ तस्थु॒रापः॑
verses.transliteration: sám anyā́ yánty úpa yanty anyā́ḥ  samānám ūrváṃ nadyàḥ pr̥ṇanti  tám ū śúciṃ śúcayo dīdivā́ṃsam  apā́ṃ nápātam pári tasthur ā́paḥ

translation.text: Some floods unite themselves and others join them: die sounding rivers fill one common storehouse. On every side the bright Floods have encompassed the bright resplendent Offspring of the Waters.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तमस्मे॑रा युव॒तयो॒ युवा॑नं मर्मृ॒ज्यमा॑नाः॒ परि॑ य॒न्त्यापः॑ स शु॒क्रेभिः॒ शिक्व॑भी रे॒वद॒स्मे दी॒दाया॑नि॒ध्मो घृ॒तनि॑र्णिग॒प्सु
verses.transliteration: tám ásmerā yuvatáyo yúvānam  marmr̥jyámānāḥ pári yanty ā́paḥ  sá śukrébhiḥ śíkvabhī revád asmé  dīdā́yānidhmó ghr̥tánirṇig apsú

translation.text: The never-sullen waters, youthful Maidens, carefully decking, wait on him the youthful. He with bright rays shines forth in splendid beauty, unfed with wood. in waters, oil-enveloped.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒स्मै ति॒स्रो अ॑व्य॒थ्याय॒ नारी॑र्दे॒वाय॑ दे॒वीर्दि॑धिष॒न्त्यन्न॑म् कृता॑ इ॒वोप॒ हि प्र॑स॒र्स्रे अ॒प्सु स पी॒यूषं॑ धयति पूर्व॒सूना॑म्
verses.transliteration: asmaí tisró avyathyā́ya nā́rīr  devā́ya devī́r didhiṣanty ánnam  kŕ̥tā ivópa hí prasarsré apsú  sá pīyū́ṣaṃ dhayati pūrvasū́nām

translation.text: To him three Dames are oftering food to feed him, Goddesses to the God whom none may injure. Within the waters hath he pressed, as hollows, and drinks their milk who now are first made mothers.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अश्व॒स्यात्र॒ जनि॑मा॒स्य च॒ स्व॑र्द्रु॒हो रि॒षः स॒म्पृचः॑ पाहि सू॒रीन् आ॒मासु॑ पू॒र्षु प॒रो अ॑प्रमृ॒ष्यं नारा॑तयो॒ वि न॑श॒न्नानृ॑तानि
verses.transliteration: áśvasyā́tra jánimāsyá ca svàr  druhó riṣáḥ sampŕ̥caḥ pāhi sūrī́n  āmā́su pūrṣú paró apramr̥ṣyáṃ  nā́rātayo ví naśan nā́nr̥tāni

translation.text: Here was the horse's birth; his was the sunlight. Save thou our princes from the oppressor's onslaught. Him, indestructible, dwelling at a distance in forts unwrought lies and ill spirits reach not.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स्व आ दमे॑ सु॒दुघा॒ यस्य॑ धे॒नुः स्व॒धां पी॑पाय सु॒भ्वन्न॑मत्ति सो अ॒पां नपा॑दू॒र्जय॑न्न॒प्स्व१॒॑न्तर्व॑सु॒देया॑य विध॒ते वि भा॑ति
verses.transliteration: svá ā́ dáme sudúghā yásya dhenúḥ  svadhā́m pīpāya subhv ánnam atti  só apā́ṃ nápād ūrjáyann apsv àntár  vasudéyāya vidhaté ví bhāti

translation.text: He, in whose mansion is the teeming Milch-cow, swells the Gods' nectar and cats noble viands. lle Son of Waters, gathering strength in waters, shines for his worshipper to give him treasures.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यो अ॒प्स्वा शुचि॑ना॒ दैव्ये॑न ऋ॒तावाज॑स्र उर्वि॒या वि॒भाति॑ व॒या इद॒न्या भुव॑नान्यस्य॒ प्र जा॑यन्ते वी॒रुध॑श्च प्र॒जाभिः॑
verses.transliteration: yó apsv ā́ śúcinā daívyena  r̥tā́vā́jasra urviyā́ vibhā́ti  vayā́ íd anyā́ bhúvanāny asya  prá jāyante vīrúdhaś ca prajā́bhiḥ

translation.text: He who in waters with his own pure Godhead shines widely, law-abiding, everlasting- The other worlds are verily his branches, and plants are born of him with all their offspring.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒पां नपा॒दा ह्यस्था॑दु॒पस्थं॑ जि॒ह्माना॑मू॒र्ध्वो वि॒द्युतं॒ वसा॑नः तस्य॒ ज्येष्ठं॑ महि॒मानं॒ वह॑न्ती॒र्हिर॑ण्यवर्णाः॒ परि॑ यन्ति य॒ह्वीः
verses.transliteration: apā́ṃ nápād ā́ hy ásthād upásthaṃ  jihmā́nām ūrdhvó vidyútaṃ vásānaḥ  tásya jyéṣṭham mahimā́naṃ váhantīr  híraṇyavarṇāḥ pári yanti yahvī́ḥ

translation.text: The Waters' Son hath risen, and clothed in lightning ascended up unto the curled cloud's bosom; And bearing with them his supremest glory the Youthful Ones, gold-coloured, move around him.

verses.sanskrit_deva: हिर॑ण्यरूपः॒ स हिर॑ण्यसंदृग॒पां नपा॒त्सेदु॒ हिर॑ण्यवर्णः हि॒र॒ण्यया॒त्परि॒ योने॑र्नि॒षद्या॑ हिरण्य॒दा द॑द॒त्यन्न॑मस्मै
verses.transliteration: híraṇyarūpaḥ sá híraṇyasaṃdr̥g  apā́ṃ nápāt séd u híraṇyavarṇaḥ  hiraṇyáyāt pári yóner niṣádyā  hiraṇyadā́ dadaty ánnam asmai

translation.text: Golden in form is he, like gold to look on, his colour is like gold, the Son of Waters. When he is seated fresh from golden birthplace those who present their gold give food to feed him.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तद॒स्यानी॑कमु॒त चारु॒ नामा॑पी॒च्यं॑ वर्धते॒ नप्तु॑र॒पाम् यमि॒न्धते॑ युव॒तयः॒ समि॒त्था हिर॑ण्यवर्णं घृ॒तमन्न॑मस्य
verses.transliteration: tád asyā́nīkam utá cā́ru nā́ma-  -apīcyàṃ vardhate náptur apā́m  yám indháte yuvatáyaḥ sám itthā́  híraṇyavarṇaṃ ghr̥tám ánnam asya

translation.text: This the fair name and this the lovely aspect of him the Waters' Son increase in secret. Whom here the youthful Maids together kindle, his food is sacred oil of golden colour.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒स्मै ब॑हू॒नाम॑व॒माय॒ सख्ये॑ य॒ज्ञैर्वि॑धेम॒ नम॑सा ह॒विर्भिः॑ सं सानु॒ मार्ज्मि॒ दिधि॑षामि॒ बिल्मै॒र्दधा॒म्यन्नैः॒ परि॑ वन्द ऋ॒ग्भिः
verses.transliteration: asmaí bahūnā́m avamā́ya sákhye  yajñaír vidhema námasā havírbhiḥ  sáṃ sā́nu mā́rjmi dídhiṣāmi bílmair  dádhāmy ánnaiḥ pári vanda r̥gbhíḥ

translation.text: Him, nearest Friend of many, will we worship with sacrifice. and reverence and oblation. I make his back to shine, with chips provide him; t offer food and with my songs exalt him.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स ईं॒ वृषा॑जनय॒त्तासु॒ गर्भं॒ स ईं॒ शिशु॑र्धयति॒ तं रि॑हन्ति सो अ॒पां नपा॒दन॑भिम्लातवर्णो॒ऽन्यस्ये॑वे॒ह त॒न्वा॑ विवेष
verses.transliteration: sá īṃ vŕ̥ṣā janayat tā́su gárbhaṃ  sá īṃ śíśur dhayati táṃ rihanti  só apā́ṃ nápād ánabhimlātavarṇo  -anyásyevehá tanvā̀ viveṣa

translation.text: The Bull hath laid his own life-germ Within them. He sucks them as an infant, and they kiss him. He, Son of Waters, of unfading colour, hadi entered here as in another's body.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒स्मिन्प॒दे प॑र॒मे त॑स्थि॒वांस॑मध्व॒स्मभि॑र्वि॒श्वहा॑ दीदि॒वांस॑म् आपो॒ नप्त्रे॑ घृ॒तमन्नं॒ वह॑न्तीः स्व॒यमत्कैः॒ परि॑ दीयन्ति य॒ह्वीः
verses.transliteration: asmín padé paramé tasthivā́ṃsam  adhvasmábhir viśváhā dīdivā́ṃsam  ā́po náptre ghr̥tám ánnaṃ váhantīḥ  svayám átkaiḥ pári dīyanti yahvī́ḥ

translation.text: While here he dwelleth in sublimest station, resplendent with the rays that never perish, The Waters, bearing oil to feed their ofispring, flow, Youthful Ones, in wanderings about him.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अयां॑समग्ने सुक्षि॒तिं जना॒यायां॑समु म॒घव॑द्भ्यः सुवृ॒क्तिम् विश्वं॒ तद्भ॒द्रं यदव॑न्ति दे॒वा बृ॒हद्व॑देम वि॒दथे॑ सु॒वीराः॑
verses.transliteration: áyāṃsam agne sukṣitíṃ jánāya-  -áyāṃsam u maghávadbhyaḥ suvr̥ktím  víśvaṃ tád bhadráṃ yád ávanti devā́ḥ-  br̥hád vadema vidáthe suvī́rāḥ

translation.text: Agni, I gave good shelter to the people, and to the princes goodly preparation. Blessed is all that Gods regard with favour. Loud may we speak, with heroes, in assembly.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तुभ्यं॑ हिन्वा॒नो व॑सिष्ट॒ गा अ॒पोऽधु॑क्षन्त्सी॒मवि॑भि॒रद्रि॑भि॒र्नरः॑ पिबे॑न्द्र॒ स्वाहा॒ प्रहु॑तं॒ वष॑ट्कृतं हो॒त्रादा सोमं॑ प्रथ॒मो य ईशि॑षे
verses.transliteration: túbhyaṃ hinvānó [']vasiṣṭa gā́ apó  -ádhukṣan sīm ávibhir ádribhir náraḥ  píbendra svā́hā práhutaṃ váṣaṭkr̥taṃ  hotrā́d ā́ sómam prathamó yá ī́śiṣe

translation.text: WATER and milk hath he endued, sent forth to thee: the men have drained him with the filters and the stones. Drink, Indra, from the Hotar's bowlfirst right is thine-Soma hallowed and poured with Vashaṭ and Svâhâ.

verses.sanskrit_deva: य॒ज्ञैः सम्मि॑श्लाः॒ पृष॑तीभिर्ऋ॒ष्टिभि॒र्याम॑ञ्छु॒भ्रासो॑ अ॒ञ्जिषु॑ प्रि॒या उ॒त आ॒सद्या॑ ब॒र्हिर्भ॑रतस्य सूनवः पो॒त्रादा सोमं॑ पिबता दिवो नरः
verses.transliteration: yajñaíḥ sámmiślāḥ pŕ̥ṣatībhir r̥ṣṭíbhir  yā́mañ chubhrā́so añjíṣu priyā́ utá  āsádyā barhír bharatasya sūnavaḥ  potrā́d ā́ sómam pibatā divo naraḥ

translation.text: Busied with sacrifice, with spotted deer and spears, gleaming upon your way with ornaments, yea, our Friends, Sitting on sacred grass, ye Sons of Bharata, drink Soma from the Potar's bowl, O Men of heaven.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒मेव॑ नः सुहवा॒ आ हि गन्त॑न॒ नि ब॒र्हिषि॑ सदतना॒ रणि॑ष्टन अथा॑ मन्दस्व जुजुषा॒णो अन्ध॑स॒स्त्वष्ट॑र्दे॒वेभि॒र्जनि॑भिः सु॒मद्ग॑णः
verses.transliteration: améva naḥ suhavā ā́ hí gántana  ní barhíṣi sadatanā ráṇiṣṭana  áthā mandasva jujuṣāṇó ándhasas  tváṣṭar devébhir jánibhiḥ sumádgaṇaḥ

translation.text: Come unto us, ye swift to listen: as at home upon the sacred grass sit and enjoy yourselves. And, Tvashṭar, well-content be joyful in the juice with Gods and Goddesses in gladsome company.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ व॑क्षि दे॒वाँ इ॒ह वि॑प्र॒ यक्षि॑ चो॒शन्हो॑त॒र्नि ष॑दा॒ योनि॑षु त्रि॒षु प्रति॑ वीहि॒ प्रस्थि॑तं सो॒म्यं मधु॒ पिबाग्नी॑ध्रा॒त्तव॑ भा॒गस्य॑ तृप्णुहि
verses.transliteration: ā́ vakṣi devā́m̐ ihá vipra yákṣi ca-  -uśán hotar ní ṣadā yóniṣu triṣú  práti vīhi prásthitaṃ somyám mádhu  píbā́gnīdhrāt táva bhāgásya tr̥pṇuhi

translation.text: Bring the Gods hither, Sage, and offer sacrifice: at the three altars seat thee willingly, O Priest. Accept for thy delight the proffered Soma meath: drink from the Kindler's bowl and fill thee with thy share.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ए॒ष स्य ते॑ त॒न्वो॑ नृम्ण॒वर्ध॑नः॒ सह॒ ओजः॑ प्र॒दिवि॑ बा॒ह्वोर्हि॒तः तुभ्यं॑ सु॒तो म॑घव॒न्तुभ्य॒माभृ॑त॒स्त्वम॑स्य॒ ब्राह्म॑णा॒दा तृ॒पत्पि॑ब
verses.transliteration: eṣá syá te tanvò nr̥mṇavárdhanaḥ  sáha ójaḥ pradívi bāhvór hitáḥ  túbhyaṃ sutó maghavan túbhyam ā́bhr̥tas  tvám asya brā́hmaṇād ā́ tr̥pát piba

translation.text: This is the strengthener of thy body's manly might: strength, victory for all time are placed within thine arms. Pressed for thee, Maghavan, it is offered unto thee: drink from the chalice of this Brahman, drink thy fill.

verses.sanskrit_deva: जु॒षेथां॑ य॒ज्ञं बोध॑तं॒ हव॑स्य मे स॒त्तो होता॑ नि॒विदः॑ पू॒र्व्या अनु॑ अच्छा॒ राजा॑ना॒ नम॑ एत्या॒वृतं॑ प्रशा॒स्त्रादा पि॑बतं सो॒म्यं मधु॑
verses.transliteration: juṣéthāṃ yajñám bódhataṃ hávasya me  sattó hótā nivídaḥ pūrvyā́ ánu  áchā rā́jānā náma ety āvŕ̥tam  praśāstrā́d ā́ pibataṃ somyám mádhu

translation.text: Accept the sacrifice; mark both of you, my call: the Priest hath seated him after the ancient texts. My prayer that bids them come goes forth to both the Kings: drink ye the Soma meath from the Director's bowl.

verses.sanskrit_deva: मन्द॑स्व हो॒त्रादनु॒ जोष॒मन्ध॒सोऽध्व॑र्यवः॒ स पू॒र्णां व॑ष्ट्या॒सिच॑म् तस्मा॑ ए॒तं भ॑रत तद्व॒शो द॒दिर्हो॒त्रात्सोमं॑ द्रविणोदः॒ पिब॑ ऋ॒तुभिः॑
verses.transliteration: mándasva hotrā́d ánu jóṣam ándhasaḥ-  -ádhvaryavaḥ sá pūrṇā́ṃ vaṣṭy āsícam  tásmā etám bharata tadvaśó dadír  hotrā́d sómaṃ draviṇodaḥ píba r̥túbhiḥ

translation.text: Enjoy thy fill of meath out of the Hotar's cup: Adhvaryus he desires a full draught poured for him. Bring it him: seeking this he gives. Granter of Wealth, drink Sorna with the Rtus from the Hotar's cup.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यमु॒ पूर्व॒महु॑वे॒ तमि॒दं हु॑वे॒ सेदु॒ हव्यो॑ द॒दिर्यो नाम॒ पत्य॑ते अ॒ध्व॒र्युभिः॒ प्रस्थि॑तं सो॒म्यं मधु॑ पो॒त्रात्सोमं॑ द्रविणोदः॒ पिब॑ ऋ॒तुभिः॑
verses.transliteration: yám u pū́rvam áhuve tám idáṃ huve  séd u hávyo dadír yó nā́ma pátyate  adhvaryúbhiḥ prásthitaṃ somyám mádhu  potrā́t sómaṃ draviṇodaḥ píba r̥túbhiḥ

translation.text: He whom of old I called on, him I call on now. He is to be invoked; his name is He who Gives, Here brought by priests is Soma meath. Granter of Wealth, drink Soma with the Rtus from the Potar's cup.

verses.sanskrit_deva: मेद्य॑न्तु ते॒ वह्न॑यो॒ येभि॒रीय॒सेऽरि॑षण्यन्वीळयस्वा वनस्पते आ॒यूया॑ धृष्णो अभि॒गूर्या॒ त्वं ने॒ष्ट्रात्सोमं॑ द्रविणोदः॒ पिब॑ ऋ॒तुभिः॑
verses.transliteration: médyantu te váhnayo yébhir ī́yase-  -áriṣaṇyan vīḷayasvā vanaspate  āyū́yā dhr̥ṣṇo abhigū́ryā tváṃ  neṣṭrā́t sómaṃ draviṇodaḥ píba r̥túbhiḥ

translation.text: Fat may the horses be wherewith thou speedest on: Lord of the Wood, unharming, strengthen thou thyself. Drawing and seizing, Bold One, thou who grantest wealth, drink Soma with the Rtus from the Neshṭar's cup.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अपा॑द्धो॒त्रादु॒त पो॒त्राद॑मत्तो॒त ने॒ष्ट्राद॑जुषत॒ प्रयो॑ हि॒तम् तु॒रीयं॒ पात्र॒ममृ॑क्त॒मम॑र्त्यं द्रविणो॒दाः पि॑बतु द्राविणोद॒सः
verses.transliteration: ápād dhotrā́d utá potrā́d amatta-  -utá neṣṭrā́d ajuṣata práyo hitám  turī́yam pā́tram ámr̥ktam ámartyaṃ  draviṇodā́ḥ pibatu drāviṇodasáḥ

translation.text: From Hotar's cup and Potar's he hath drunk and joyed: the proffered food hath pleased him from the Neshṭar's bowl. The fourth cup undisturbed, immortal, let him drink who giveth wealth, the cup of the wealth-giving God.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒र्वाञ्च॑म॒द्य य॒य्यं॑ नृ॒वाह॑णं॒ रथं॑ युञ्जाथामि॒ह वां॑ वि॒मोच॑नम् पृ॒ङ्क्तं ह॒वींषि॒ मधु॒ना हि कं॑ ग॒तमथा॒ सोमं॑ पिबतं वाजिनीवसू
verses.transliteration: arvā́ñcam adyá yayyàṃ nr̥vā́haṇaṃ  ráthaṃ yuñjāthām ihá vāṃ vimócanam  pr̥ṅktáṃ havī́ṃṣi mádhunā́ hí kaṃ gatám  áthā sómam pibataṃ vājinīvasū

translation.text: Yoke, O ye Twain, to-day your hero-bearing car, swift-moving hitherward: your loosing-place is here. Mix the oblations, then come hither with the meath, and drink the Soma, ye rich in abundant strength.

verses.sanskrit_deva: जोष्य॑ग्ने स॒मिधं॒ जोष्याहु॑तिं॒ जोषि॒ ब्रह्म॒ जन्यं॒ जोषि॑ सुष्टु॒तिम् विश्वे॑भि॒र्विश्वाँ॑ ऋ॒तुना॑ वसो म॒ह उ॒शन्दे॒वाँ उ॑श॒तः पा॑यया ह॒विः
verses.transliteration: jóṣy agne samídhaṃ jóṣy ā́hutiṃ  jóṣi bráhma jányaṃ jóṣi suṣṭutím  víśvebhir víśvām̐ r̥túnā vaso maháḥ-  uśán devā́m̐ uśatáḥ pāyayā havíḥ

translation.text: Agni, accept the fuel and our offered gift: accept the prayer of man, accept our eulogy, Do thou with all, with Rtu, O thou Excellent, fain, make the great Gods all fain taste the gift we bring.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उदु॒ ष्य दे॒वः स॑वि॒ता स॒वाय॑ शश्वत्त॒मं तद॑पा॒ वह्नि॑रस्थात् नू॒नं दे॒वेभ्यो॒ वि हि धाति॒ रत्न॒मथाभ॑जद्वी॒तिहो॑त्रं स्व॒स्तौ
verses.transliteration: úd u ṣyá deváḥ savitā́ savā́ya  śaśvattamáṃ tádapā váhnir asthāt  nūnáṃ devébhyo ví hí dhā́ti rátnam  áthā́bhajad vītíhotraṃ svastaú

translation.text: UPRISEN is Savitar, this God, to quicken, Priest who neglects not this most constant duty. To the Gods, verily, he gives rich treasure, and blesses him who calls them to the banquet.

verses.sanskrit_deva: विश्व॑स्य॒ हि श्रु॒ष्टये॑ दे॒व ऊ॒र्ध्वः प्र बा॒हवा॑ पृ॒थुपा॑णिः॒ सिस॑र्ति आप॑श्चिदस्य व्र॒त आ निमृ॑ग्रा अ॒यं चि॒द्वातो॑ रमते॒ परि॑ज्मन्
verses.transliteration: víśvasya hí śruṣṭáye devá ūrdhváḥ  prá bāhávā pr̥thúpāṇiḥ sísarti  ā́paś cid asya vratá ā́ nímr̥grāḥ-  ayáṃ cid vā́to ramate párijman

translation.text: Having gone up on high, the God broadhanded spreads his arms widely forth that all may mark him. Even the waters bend them to his service: even this wind rests in the circling region.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ॒शुभि॑श्चि॒द्यान्वि मु॑चाति नू॒नमरी॑रम॒दत॑मानं चि॒देतोः॑ अ॒ह्यर्षू॑णां चि॒न्न्य॑याँ अवि॒ष्यामनु॑ व्र॒तं स॑वि॒तुर्मोक्यागा॑त्
verses.transliteration: āśúbhiś cid yā́n ví mucāti nūnám  árīramad átamānaṃ cid étoḥ  ahyárṣūṇāṃ cin ny àyām̐ aviṣyā́m  ánu vratáṃ savitúr móky ā́gāt

translation.text: Though borne by swift steeds he will yet unyoke them: e'en the fleet chariot hath he stayed from going. He hath checked e'en their haste who glide like serpents. Night closely followed Savitar's dominion.

verses.sanskrit_deva: पुनः॒ सम॑व्य॒द्वित॑तं॒ वय॑न्ती म॒ध्या कर्तो॒र्न्य॑धा॒च्छक्म॒ धीरः॑ उत्सं॒हाया॑स्था॒द्व्यृ१॒॑तूँर॑दर्धर॒रम॑तिः सवि॒ता दे॒व आगा॑त्
verses.transliteration: púnaḥ sám avyad vítataṃ váyantī  madhyā́ kártor ny àdhāc chákma dhī́raḥ  út saṃhā́yāsthād vy r̥̀tū́m̐r adardhar  arámatiḥ savitā́ devá ā́gāt

translation.text: What was spread out she weaves afresh, re-weaving: the skilful leaves his labour half-completed. He hath arisen from rest, and parted seasons: Savitar hath approached, God, holy-minded.

verses.sanskrit_deva: नानौकां॑सि॒ दुर्यो॒ विश्व॒मायु॒र्वि ति॑ष्ठते प्रभ॒वः शोको॑ अ॒ग्नेः ज्येष्ठं॑ मा॒ता सू॒नवे॑ भा॒गमाधा॒दन्व॑स्य॒ केत॑मिषि॒तं स॑वि॒त्रा
verses.transliteration: nā́naúkāṃsi dúryo víśvam ā́yur  ví tiṣṭhate prabhaváḥ śóko agnéḥ  jyéṣṭham mātā́ sūnáve bhāgám ā́dhād  ánv asya kétam iṣitáṃ savitrā́

translation.text: Tlirough various dwellings, through entire existence, spreads, manifest, the household light of Agni. The Mother gives her Son the goodliest portion, and Savitar hath sped to meet his summons.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स॒माव॑वर्ति॒ विष्ठि॑तो जिगी॒षुर्विश्वे॑षां॒ काम॒श्चर॑ताम॒माभू॑त् शश्वाँ॒ अपो॒ विकृ॑तं हि॒त्व्यागा॒दनु॑ व्र॒तं स॑वि॒तुर्दैव्य॑स्य
verses.transliteration: samā́vavarti víṣṭhito jigīṣúr  víśveṣāṃ kā́maś cáratām amā́bhūt  śáśvām̐ ápo víkr̥taṃ hitvy ā́gād  ánu vratáṃ savitúr daívyasya

translation.text: He comes again, unfolded, fain for conquest: at home was he, the love of all things moving. Each man hath come leaving his evil doings, after the Godlike Savitar's commandment.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वया॑ हि॒तमप्य॑म॒प्सु भा॒गं धन्वान्वा मृ॑ग॒यसो॒ वि त॑स्थुः वना॑नि॒ विभ्यो॒ नकि॑रस्य॒ तानि॑ व्र॒ता दे॒वस्य॑ सवि॒तुर्मि॑नन्ति
verses.transliteration: tváyā hitám ápyam apsú bhāgáṃ  dhánvā́nv ā́ mr̥gayáso ví tasthuḥ  vánāni víbhyo nákir asya tā́ni  vratā́ devásya savitúr minanti

translation.text: The wild beasts spread through desert places seeking their watery share which thou hast set in waters. The woods are given to the birds. These statutes of the God Savitar none disobeyeth.

verses.sanskrit_deva: या॒द्रा॒ध्यं१॒॑ वरु॑णो॒ योनि॒मप्य॒मनि॑शितं नि॒मिषि॒ जर्भु॑राणः विश्वो॑ मार्ता॒ण्डो व्र॒जमा प॒शुर्गा॑त्स्थ॒शो जन्मा॑नि सवि॒ता व्याकः॑
verses.transliteration: yādrādhyàṃ váruṇo yónim ápyam  ániśitaṃ nimíṣi járbhurāṇaḥ  víśvo mārtāṇḍó vrajám ā́ paśúr gāt  sthaśó jánmāni savitā́ vy ā́kaḥ

translation.text: With utmost speed, in restless haste at sunset Varuṇa seeks his watery habitation. Then seeks each bird his nest, each beast his lodging. In due place Savitar hath set each creature.

verses.sanskrit_deva: न यस्येन्द्रो॒ वरु॑णो॒ न मि॒त्रो व्र॒तम॑र्य॒मा न मि॒नन्ति॑ रु॒द्रः नारा॑तय॒स्तमि॒दं स्व॒स्ति हु॒वे दे॒वं स॑वि॒तारं॒ नमो॑भिः
verses.transliteration: ná yásyéndro váruṇo ná mitró  vratám aryamā́ ná minánti rudráḥ  nā́rātayas tám idáṃ svastí  huvé deváṃ savitā́raṃ námobhiḥ

translation.text: Him whose high law not Varuṇa nor Indra, not Mitra, Aryaman, nor Rudra breaketh, Nor evil-hearted fiends, here for my welfare him I invoke, God Savitar, with worship.

verses.sanskrit_deva: भगं॒ धियं॑ वा॒जय॑न्तः॒ पुरं॑धिं॒ नरा॒शंसो॒ ग्नास्पति॑र्नो अव्याः आ॒ये वा॒मस्य॑ संग॒थे र॑यी॒णां प्रि॒या दे॒वस्य॑ सवि॒तुः स्या॑म
verses.transliteration: bhágaṃ dhíyaṃ vājáyantaḥ púraṃdhiṃ  nárāśáṃso gnā́spátir no avyāḥ  āyé vāmásya saṃgathé rayīṇā́m  priyā́ devásya savitúḥ syāma

translation.text: May they who strengthen bliss, and thought and wisdom, and the Dames' Lord and Narâṣansa aid us. That good may come to us and wealth be gathered, may we be Savitar the God's beloved.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒स्मभ्यं॒ तद्दि॒वो अ॒द्भ्यः पृ॑थि॒व्यास्त्वया॑ द॒त्तं काम्यं॒ राध॒ आ गा॑त् शं यत्स्तो॒तृभ्य॑ आ॒पये॒ भवा॑त्युरु॒शंसा॑य सवितर्जरि॒त्रे
verses.transliteration: asmábhyaṃ tád divó adbhyáḥ pr̥thivyā́s  tváyā dattáṃ kā́myaṃ rā́dha ā́ gāt  śáṃ yát stotŕ̥bhya āpáye bhávāti-  uruśáṃsāya savitar jaritré

translation.text: So come to us our hearts' desire, the bounty bestowed by thee, from heaven and earth and waters, That it be well with friends and those who praise thee, and, Savitar, with the loud-lauding singer.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ग्रावा॑णेव॒ तदिदर्थं॑ जरेथे॒ गृध्रे॑व वृ॒क्षं नि॑धि॒मन्त॒मच्छ॑ ब्र॒ह्माणे॑व वि॒दथ॑ उक्थ॒शासा॑ दू॒तेव॒ हव्या॒ जन्या॑ पुरु॒त्रा
verses.transliteration: grā́vāṇeva tád íd árthaṃ jarethe  gŕ̥dhreva vr̥kṣáṃ nidhimántam ácha  brahmā́ṇeva vidátha ukthaśā́sā  dūtéva hávyā jányā purutrā́

translation.text: SING like the two press-stones for this same purpose; come like two misers to the tree of treasure; Like two laud-singing Brahmans in the assembly, like the folk's envoys called in many places.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्रा॒त॒र्यावा॑णा र॒थ्ये॑व वी॒राजेव॑ य॒मा वर॒मा स॑चेथे मेने॑ इव त॒न्वा॒३॒॑ शुम्भ॑माने॒ दम्प॑तीव क्रतु॒विदा॒ जने॑षु
verses.transliteration: prātaryā́vāṇā rathyèva vīrā́-  -ajéva yamā́ váram ā́ sacethe  méne iva tanvā̀ śúmbhamāne  dámpatīva kratuvídā jáneṣu

translation.text: Moving at morning like two chr-borne heroes, like to a pair of goats ye come electing; Like two fair dames embellishing their bodies, like a wise married pair among the people.

verses.sanskrit_deva: शृङ्गे॑व नः प्रथ॒मा ग॑न्तम॒र्वाक्छ॒फावि॑व॒ जर्भु॑राणा॒ तरो॑भिः च॒क्र॒वा॒केव॒ प्रति॒ वस्तो॑रुस्रा॒र्वाञ्चा॑ यातं र॒थ्ये॑व शक्रा
verses.transliteration: śŕ̥ṅgeva naḥ prathamā́ gantam arvā́k  -śaphā́v iva járbhurāṇā tárobhiḥ  cakravākéva práti vástor usrā-  -arvā́ñcā yātaṃ rathyèva śakrā

translation.text: Like to a pair of horns come first to usward, like to a pair of hoofs with rapid motion; Come like two Chakwâs in the grey of morning, come like two chariot wheels at dawn, ye Mighty.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ना॒वेव॑ नः पारयतं यु॒गेव॒ नभ्ये॑व न उप॒धीव॑ प्र॒धीव॑ श्वाने॑व नो॒ अरि॑षण्या त॒नूनां॒ खृग॑लेव वि॒स्रसः॑ पातम॒स्मान्
verses.transliteration: nāvéva naḥ pārayataṃ yugéva  nábhyeva na upadhī́va pradhī́va  śvā́neva no áriṣaṇyā tanū́nāṃ  khŕ̥galeva visrásaḥ pātam asmā́n

translation.text: Bear us across the rivers like two vessels, save us as ye were yokes, naves, spokes and fellies. Be like two dogs that injure not our bodies; preserve us, like two crutches, that we fall not.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वाते॑वाजु॒र्या न॒द्ये॑व री॒तिर॒क्षी इ॑व॒ चक्षु॒षा या॑तम॒र्वाक् हस्ता॑विव त॒न्वे॒३॒॑ शम्भ॑विष्ठा॒ पादे॑व नो नयतं॒ वस्यो॒ अच्छ॑
verses.transliteration: vā́tevājuryā́ nadyèva rītír  akṣī́ iva cákṣuṣā́ yātam arvā́k  hástāv iva tanvè śámbhaviṣṭhā  pā́deva no nayataṃ vásyo ácha

translation.text: Like two winds ageing not, two confluent rivers, come with quick vision like two eyes before us. Come like two hands most helpful to the body, and guide us like two feet to what is precious.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ओष्ठा॑विव॒ मध्वा॒स्ने वद॑न्ता॒ स्तना॑विव पिप्यतं जी॒वसे॑ नः नासे॑व नस्त॒न्वो॑ रक्षि॒तारा॒ कर्णा॑विव सु॒श्रुता॑ भूतम॒स्मे
verses.transliteration: óṣṭhāv iva mádhv āsné vádantā  stánāv iva pipyataṃ jīváse naḥ  nā́seva nas tanvò rakṣitā́rā  kárṇāv iva suśrútā bhūtam asmé

translation.text: Even as two lips that with the mouth speak honey, even as two breasts that nourish our existence, Like the two nostrils that protect our being, be to us as our ears that hear distinctly.

verses.sanskrit_deva: हस्ते॑व श॒क्तिम॒भि सं॑द॒दी नः॒ क्षामे॑व नः॒ सम॑जतं॒ रजां॑सि इ॒मा गिरो॑ अश्विना युष्म॒यन्तीः॒ क्ष्णोत्रे॑णेव॒ स्वधि॑तिं॒ सं शि॑शीतम्
verses.transliteration: hásteva śaktím abhí saṃdadī́ naḥ  kṣā́meva naḥ sám ajataṃ rájāṃsi  imā́ gíro aśvinā yuṣmayántīḥ  kṣṇótreṇeva svádhitiṃ sáṃ śiśītam

translation.text: Like two hands give ye us increasing vigour; like heaven and earth constrain the airy regions. Aṣvins, these hymns that struggle to approach you, sharpen ye like an axe upon a whetstone.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ए॒तानि॑ वामश्विना॒ वर्ध॑नानि॒ ब्रह्म॒ स्तोमं॑ गृत्सम॒दासो॑ अक्रन् तानि॑ नरा जुजुषा॒णोप॑ यातं बृ॒हद्व॑देम वि॒दथे॑ सु॒वीराः॑
verses.transliteration: etā́ni vām aśvinā várdhanāni  bráhma stómaṃ gr̥tsamadā́so akran  tā́ni narā jujuṣāṇópa yātam  br̥hád vadema vidáthe suvī́rāḥ

translation.text: These prayers of ours exalting you, O Aṣvins, have the Gr̥itsamadas, for a laud, made ready. Welcome them, O ye Heroes, and come bither. Loud may we speak. with brave men, in assembly.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सोमा॑पूषणा॒ जन॑ना रयी॒णां जन॑ना दि॒वो जन॑ना पृथि॒व्याः जा॒तौ विश्व॑स्य॒ भुव॑नस्य गो॒पौ दे॒वा अ॑कृण्वन्न॒मृत॑स्य॒ नाभि॑म्
verses.transliteration: sómāpūṣaṇā jánanā rayīṇā́ṃ  jánanā divó jánanā pr̥thivyā́ḥ  jātaú víśvasya bhúvanasya gopaú  devā́ akr̥ṇvann amŕ̥tasya nā́bhim

translation.text: SOMA and Pûshan, Parents of all riches, Parents of earth and Parents of high heaven, You Twain, brought forth as the whole world's protectors, the Gods have made centre of life eternal.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इ॒मौ दे॒वौ जाय॑मानौ जुषन्ते॒मौ तमां॑सि गूहता॒मजु॑ष्टा आ॒भ्यामिन्द्रः॑ प॒क्वमा॒मास्व॒न्तः सो॑मापू॒षभ्यां॑ जनदु॒स्रिया॑सु
verses.transliteration: imaú devaú jā́yamānau juṣanta-  -imaú támāṃsi gūhatām ájuṣṭā  ābhyā́m índraḥ pakvám āmā́sv antáḥ  somāpūṣábhyāṃ janad usríyāsu

translation.text: At birth of these two Gods all Gods are joyful: they have caused darkness, which we hate, to vanish. With these, with Soma and with Pûshan, India generates ripe warm milk in the raw milch-cows.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सोमा॑पूषणा॒ रज॑सो वि॒मानं॑ स॒प्तच॑क्रं॒ रथ॒मवि॑श्वमिन्वम् वि॒षू॒वृतं॒ मन॑सा यु॒ज्यमा॑नं॒ तं जि॑न्वथो वृषणा॒ पञ्च॑रश्मिम्
verses.transliteration: sómāpūṣaṇā rájaso vimā́naṃ  saptácakraṃ rátham áviśvaminvam  viṣūvŕ̥tam mánasā yujyámānaṃ  táṃ jinvatho vr̥ṣaṇā páñcaraśmim

translation.text: Soma and Pûshan, urge your chariot hither, the seven-wheeIed car that measures out the region, That stirs not all, that moves to every quarter, fivc-reined and harnessed by the thought, ye Mighty.

verses.sanskrit_deva: दि॒व्य१॒॑न्यः सद॑नं च॒क्र उ॒च्चा पृ॑थि॒व्याम॒न्यो अध्य॒न्तरि॑क्षे ताव॒स्मभ्यं॑ पुरु॒वारं॑ पुरु॒क्षुं रा॒यस्पोषं॒ वि ष्य॑तां॒ नाभि॑म॒स्मे
verses.transliteration: divy ànyáḥ sádanaṃ cakrá uccā́  pr̥thivyā́m anyó ádhy antárikṣe  tā́v asmábhyam puruvā́ram purukṣúṃ  rāyás póṣaṃ ví ṣyatāṃ nā́bhim asmé

translation.text: One in the heaven on high hath made his dwelling, on earth and in the firmament the other. May they disclose to us great store of treasure, much-longed for, rich in food, source of enjoyment.

verses.sanskrit_deva: विश्वा॑न्य॒न्यो भुव॑ना ज॒जान॒ विश्व॑म॒न्यो अ॑भि॒चक्षा॑ण एति सोमा॑पूषणा॒वव॑तं॒ धियं॑ मे यु॒वाभ्यां॒ विश्वाः॒ पृत॑ना जयेम
verses.transliteration: víśvāny anyó bhúvanā jajā́na  víśvam anyó abhicákṣāṇa eti  sómāpūṣaṇāv ávataṃ dhíyam me  yuvā́bhyāṃ víśvāḥ pŕ̥tanā jayema

translation.text: One of you Twain is Parent of all creatures, the otherjourneys onward all-beholding. Soma and Pûshan, aid my thought with favour: with you may we o'ercome in all encounters.

verses.sanskrit_deva: धियं॑ पू॒षा जि॑न्वतु विश्वमि॒न्वो र॒यिं सोमो॑ रयि॒पति॑र्दधातु अव॑तु दे॒व्यदि॑तिरन॒र्वा बृ॒हद्व॑देम वि॒दथे॑ सु॒वीराः॑
verses.transliteration: dhíyam pūṣā́ jinvatu viśvaminvó  rayíṃ sómo rayipátir dadhātu  ávatu devy áditir anarvā́  br̥hád vadema vidáthe suvī́rāḥ

translation.text: May Pûshan stir our thought, the all-impelling, may Soma Lord of riches grant us riches. May Aditi the perfect Goddess aid us. Loud may we speak, with heroes, in assembly.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वायो॒ ये ते॑ सह॒स्रिणो॒ रथा॑स॒स्तेभि॒रा ग॑हि नि॒युत्वा॒न्त्सोम॑पीतये
verses.transliteration: vā́yo yé te sahasríṇo  ráthāsas tébhir ā́ gahi  niyútvān sómapītaye

translation.text: O Vâyu, come to us with all the thousand chariots that are thine, Team-borne, to drink the Soma juice.

verses.sanskrit_deva: नि॒युत्वा॑न्वाय॒वा ग॑ह्य॒यं शु॒क्रो अ॑यामि ते गन्ता॑सि सुन्व॒तो गृ॒हम्
verses.transliteration: niyútvān vāyav ā́ gahi-  ayáṃ śukró ayāmi te  gántāsi sunvató gr̥hám

translation.text: Drawn by thy team, O Vâyu, come; to thee is offered this, the pure. Thou visitest the presser's house.

verses.sanskrit_deva: शु॒क्रस्या॒द्य गवा॑शिर॒ इन्द्र॑वायू नि॒युत्व॑तः आ या॑तं॒ पिब॑तं नरा
verses.transliteration: śukrásyādyá gávāśiraḥ-  índravāyū niyútvataḥ  ā́ yātam píbataṃ narā

translation.text: Indra and Vâyu, drawn by teams, ye Heroes, come today and drink. Of the bright juice when blent with milk.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒यं वां॑ मित्रावरुणा सु॒तः सोम॑ ऋतावृधा ममेदि॒ह श्रु॑तं॒ हव॑म्
verses.transliteration: ayáṃ vām mitrāvaruṇā  sutáḥ sóma r̥tāvr̥dhā  máméd ihá śrutaṃ hávam

translation.text: This Soma hath been shed for you, Lawstrengtheners, Mitra-Varuṇa! Listen ye here to this my call.

verses.sanskrit_deva: राजा॑ना॒वन॑भिद्रुहा ध्रु॒वे सद॑स्युत्त॒मे स॒हस्र॑स्थूण आसाते
verses.transliteration: rā́jānāv ánabhidruhā  dhruvé sádasy uttamé  sahásrasthūṇa āsāte

translation.text: Both Kings who never injure aught seat them in their supremest home, The thousand-pillared, firmly-based.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ता स॒म्राजा॑ घृ॒तासु॑ती आदि॒त्या दानु॑न॒स्पती॑ सचे॑ते॒ अन॑वह्वरम्
verses.transliteration: tā́ samrā́jā ghr̥tā́sutī  ādityā́ dā́nunas pátī  sácete ánavahvaram

translation.text: Fed with oblation, Sovran Kings, Âdityas, Lords of liberal gifts. They wait on him whose life is true.

verses.sanskrit_deva: गोम॑दू॒ षु ना॑स॒त्याश्वा॑वद्यातमश्विना व॒र्ती रु॑द्रा नृ॒पाय्य॑म्
verses.transliteration: gómad ū ṣú nāsatyā-  -áśvāvad yātam aśvinā  vartī́ rudrā nr̥pā́yyam

translation.text: With kine, Nâsatyas, and with steeds, come, Aṣvins, Rudras, to the house That will protect its heroes well;

verses.sanskrit_deva: न यत्परो॒ नान्त॑र आद॒धर्ष॑द्वृषण्वसू दुः॒शंसो॒ मर्त्यो॑ रि॒पुः
verses.transliteration: ná yát páro nā́ntaraḥ-  ādadhárṣad vr̥ṣaṇvasū  duḥśáṃso mártyo ripúḥ

translation.text: Such, wealthy Gods! as none afar nor standing nigh to us may harm, Yea, no malicious mortal foe.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ता न॒ आ वो॑ळ्हमश्विना र॒यिं पि॒शङ्ग॑संदृशम् धिष्ण्या॑ वरिवो॒विद॑म्
verses.transliteration: tā́ na ā́ voḷham aśvinā  rayím piśáṅgasaṃdr̥śam  dhíṣṇyā varivovídam

translation.text: As such, O longed-far Aṣvins, lead us on to wealth of varied sort, Wealth that shall bring us room and rest.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इन्द्रो॑ अ॒ङ्ग म॒हद्भ॒यम॒भी षदप॑ चुच्यवत् स हि स्थि॒रो विच॑र्षणिः
verses.transliteration: índro aṅgá mahád bhayám  abhī́ ṣád ápa cucyavat  sá hí sthiró vícarṣaṇiḥ

translation.text: Verily Indra, conquering all, driveth e'en mighty fear away, For firm is he and swift to act.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इन्द्र॑श्च मृ॒ळया॑ति नो॒ न नः॑ प॒श्चाद॒घं न॑शत् भ॒द्रं भ॑वाति नः पु॒रः
verses.transliteration: índraś ca mr̥ḷáyāti no  ná naḥ paścā́d agháṃ naśat  bhadrám bhavāti naḥ puráḥ

translation.text: Indra be gracious unto us: sin shall not reach us afterward, And good shall be before us still.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इन्द्र॒ आशा॑भ्य॒स्परि॒ सर्वा॑भ्यो॒ अभ॑यं करत् जेता॒ शत्रू॒न्विच॑र्षणिः
verses.transliteration: índra ā́śābhyas pári  sárvābhyo ábhayaṃ karat  jétā śátrūn vícarṣaṇiḥ

translation.text: From all the regions of the world let Indra send security, The foe-subduer, swift to act.

verses.sanskrit_deva: विश्वे॑ देवास॒ आ ग॑त शृणु॒ता म॑ इ॒मं हव॑म् एदं ब॒र्हिर्नि षी॑दत
verses.transliteration: víśve devāsa ā́ gata  śr̥ṇutā́ ma imáṃ hávam  édám barhír ní ṣīdata

translation.text: O all ye Gods, come hitherward: hear this mine invocation, seat Yourselves upon this sacred grass.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ती॒व्रो वो॒ मधु॑माँ अ॒यं शु॒नहो॑त्रेषु मत्स॒रः ए॒तं पि॑बत॒ काम्य॑म्
verses.transliteration: tīvró vo mádhumām̐ ayáṃ  śunáhotreṣu matsaráḥ  etám pibata kā́myam

translation.text: Among the Ṣunahotras strong for you is this sweet gladdening draught. Drink ye of this delightsome juice.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इन्द्र॑ज्येष्ठा॒ मरु॑द्गणा॒ देवा॑सः॒ पूष॑रातयः विश्वे॒ मम॑ श्रुता॒ हव॑म्
verses.transliteration: índrajyeṣṭhā márudgaṇāḥ-  dévāsaḥ pū́ṣarātayaḥ  víśve máma śrutā hávam

translation.text: Ye Martus led by Indra, Gods with Pri§an for your bounteousest, Hear all of you this call of mine.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अम्बि॑तमे॒ नदी॑तमे॒ देवि॑तमे॒ सर॑स्वति अ॒प्र॒श॒स्ता इ॑व स्मसि॒ प्रश॑स्तिमम्ब नस्कृधि
verses.transliteration: ámbitame nádītame  dévitame sárasvati  apraśastā́ iva smasi  práśastim amba nas kr̥dhi

translation.text: Best Mother, best of Rivers, best of Goddesses, Sarasvatî, We are, as 'twere, of no repute and dear Mother, give thou us renown.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वे विश्वा॑ सरस्वति श्रि॒तायूं॑षि दे॒व्याम् शु॒नहो॑त्रेषु मत्स्व प्र॒जां दे॑वि दिदिड्ढि नः
verses.transliteration: tvé víśvā sarasvati  śritā́yūṃṣi devyā́m  śunáhotreṣu matsva  prajā́ṃ devi didiḍḍhi naḥ

translation.text: In thee, Sarasvatî, divine, all generations have their stay. Be, glad with Ṣunahotra's sons: O Goddess grant us progeny.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इ॒मा ब्रह्म॑ सरस्वति जु॒षस्व॑ वाजिनीवति या ते॒ मन्म॑ गृत्सम॒दा ऋ॑तावरि प्रि॒या दे॒वेषु॒ जुह्व॑ति
verses.transliteration: imā́ bráhma sarasvati  juṣásva vājinīvati  yā́ te mánma gr̥tsamadā́ r̥tāvari  priyā́ devéṣu júhvati

translation.text: Enriched with sacrifice, accept Sarasvatî, these prayers of ours, Thoughts which Gr̥itsamadas beloved of Gods bring, Holy One,to thee.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्रेतां॑ य॒ज्ञस्य॑ श॒म्भुवा॑ यु॒वामिदा वृ॑णीमहे अ॒ग्निं च॑ हव्य॒वाह॑नम्
verses.transliteration: prétāṃ yajñásya śambhúvā  yuvā́m íd ā́ vr̥ṇīmahe  agníṃ ca havyavā́hanam

translation.text: Ye who bless sacrifice, go forth, for verily we choose you both, And Agni who conveys our gifts.

verses.sanskrit_deva: द्यावा॑ नः पृथि॒वी इ॒मं सि॒ध्रम॒द्य दि॑वि॒स्पृश॑म् य॒ज्ञं दे॒वेषु॑ यच्छताम्
verses.transliteration: dyā́vā naḥ pr̥thivī́ imáṃ  sidhrám adyá divispŕ̥śam  yajñáṃ devéṣu yachatām

translation.text: This our.effectual sacrifice, reaching the sky, shall Heaven and Earth Present unto the Gods to-day.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ वा॑मु॒पस्थ॑मद्रुहा दे॒वाः सी॑दन्तु य॒ज्ञियाः॑ इ॒हाद्य सोम॑पीतये
verses.transliteration: ā́ vām upástham adruhā  devā́ḥ sīdantu yajñíyāḥ  ihā́dyá sómapītaye

translation.text: In both your laps, ye guileless Ones, the Holy Gods shall sit them down To-day to drink the Soma here.

verses.sanskrit_deva: कनि॑क्रदज्ज॒नुषं॑ प्रब्रुवा॒ण इय॑र्ति॒ वाच॑मरि॒तेव॒ नाव॑म् सु॒म॒ङ्गल॑श्च शकुने॒ भवा॑सि॒ मा त्वा॒ का चि॑दभि॒भा विश्व्या॑ विदत्
verses.transliteration: kánikradaj janúṣam prabruvāṇáḥ-  íyarti vā́cam aritéva nā́vam  sumaṅgálaś ca śakune bhávāsi  mā́ tvā kā́ cid abhibhā́ víśvyā vidat

translation.text: TELLING his race aloud with cries repeated, he sends his voice out as his boat a steersman. O Bird, be ominous of happy fortune from no side may calamity befall thee.

verses.sanskrit_deva: मा त्वा॑ श्ये॒न उद्व॑धी॒न्मा सु॑प॒र्णो मा त्वा॑ विद॒दिषु॑मान्वी॒रो अस्ता॑ पित्र्या॒मनु॑ प्र॒दिशं॒ कनि॑क्रदत्सुम॒ङ्गलो॑ भद्रवा॒दी व॑दे॒ह
verses.transliteration: mā́ tvā śyená úd vadhīn mā́ suparṇó  mā́ tvā vidad íṣumān vīró ástā  pítryām ánu pradíśaṃ kánikradat  sumaṅgálo bhadravādī́ vadehá

translation.text: Let not the falcon kill thee, nor the eagle let not the arrow-bearing archer reach thee. Still crying in the region of the Fathers, speak here auspicious, bearing joyful tidings.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अव॑ क्रन्द दक्षिण॒तो गृ॒हाणां॑ सुम॒ङ्गलो॑ भद्रवा॒दी श॑कुन्ते मा नः॑ स्ते॒न ई॑शत॒ माघशं॑सो बृ॒हद्व॑देम वि॒दथे॑ सु॒वीराः॑
verses.transliteration: áva kranda dakṣiṇató gr̥hā́ṇāṃ  sumaṅgálo bhadravādī́ śakunte  mā́ na stená īśata mā́gháśaṃso  br̥hád vadema vidáthe suvī́rāḥ

translation.text: Bringing good tidings, Bird of happy omen, call thou out loudly southward of our dwellings, So that no thief, no sinner may oppress us. Loud may we speak, with heroes, in assembly.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र॒द॒क्षि॒णिद॒भि गृ॑णन्ति का॒रवो॒ वयो॒ वद॑न्त ऋतु॒था श॒कुन्त॑यः उ॒भे वाचौ॑ वदति साम॒गा इ॑व गाय॒त्रं च॒ त्रैष्टु॑भं॒ चानु॑ राजति
verses.transliteration: pradakṣiṇíd abhí gr̥ṇanti kārávo  váyo vádanta r̥tuthā́ śakúntayaḥ  ubhé vā́cau vadati sāmagā́ iva  gāyatráṃ ca traíṣṭubhaṃ cā́nu rājati

translation.text: HERE on the right sing forth chanters of hymns of praise, even the winged birds that in due season speak. He, like: a Sâma-chanter utters both the notes, skilled in the mode of Trishṭup and of Gâyatrî.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उ॒द्गा॒तेव॑ शकुने॒ साम॑ गायसि ब्रह्मपु॒त्र इ॑व॒ सव॑नेषु शंससि वृषे॑व वा॒जी शिशु॑मतीर॒पीत्या॑ स॒र्वतो॑ नः शकुने भ॒द्रमा व॑द वि॒श्वतो॑ नः शकुने॒ पुण्य॒मा व॑द
verses.transliteration: udgātéva śakune sā́ma gāyasi  brahmaputrá iva sávaneṣu śaṃsasi  vŕ̥ṣeva vājī́ śíśumatīr apī́tyā  sarváto naḥ śakune bhadrám ā́ vada  viśváto naḥ śakune púṇyam ā́ vada

translation.text: Thou like the chanter-priest chantest the Sâma, Bird; thou singest at libations like a Brahman's son. Even as a vigorous horse when he comes near the mare, announce to us good forturue, Bird, on every side, proclaim in all directions happy luck, O Bird.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ॒वदँ॒स्त्वं श॑कुने भ॒द्रमा व॑द तू॒ष्णीमासी॑नः सुम॒तिं चि॑किद्धि नः यदु॒त्पत॒न्वद॑सि कर्क॒रिर्य॑था बृ॒हद्व॑देम वि॒दथे॑ सु॒वीराः॑
verses.transliteration: āvádaṃs tváṃ śakune bhadrám ā́ vada  tūṣṇī́m ā́sīnaḥ sumatíṃ cikiddhi naḥ  yád utpátan vádasi karkarír yathā  br̥hád vadema vidáthe suvī́rāḥ

translation.text: When singing here, O Bird. announce good luck to us, and when thou sittest still think on us with kind thoughts. When flying off thou singest thou art like a lute. With brave sons in assembly may we speak aloud.
